Carmen Olga; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz, la socia vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como arena, yeso y arena para terminar de construir su casa.   
                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Olga, 39, is a member of the “Sayhua 3” communal bank that’s located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business buying and selling corn.  She sells in Urubamba’s market from 7am until 4pm.  She wants to finish building her house. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell corn.  She’s asking for the loan to buy building materials and supplies like sand, plaster and sand to finish building her house.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jeniffer Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jeniffer es una mujer de 24 años muy alegre, trabajadora y emprendedora, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que tienen 7 años y el otro de 10 meses de edad. Recide en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Jeniffer es comerciante ambulante de ropa interior, negocio que le genera ingresos buenos ya que necesita cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Es el primer crédito que realiza a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizaqdo en la compra de mercadería ya que en las temporadas navideñas las ventas e ingresos se incrementan mejorando la calidad de vida de Jeniffer y de sus hijos.

Su sueño es comprar una camioneta con la cual pueda salir a vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Jeniffer, 24, is a very cheerful, hardworking and enterprising woman living with her husband and two children who are 7 years old and 10 months old; she lives in the city of Ibarra.

Jeniffer is an itinerant underwear merchant.  The business generates good income since she needs to cover her children’s needs.  This is her first Fodemi loan and she will use it to buy merchandise because during the Christmas season sales and income increase improving the quality of life for Jeniffer and her children.  Her dream is to buy a vehicle that she can use to go out and sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ruti

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruti; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia también se dedica a distribuir medicamentos a las diferentes farmacias del distrito de Urubamba, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y así poder mejorar la atención de su restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ruti, 41, is a member of the “Sayhua 3” communal bank that’s located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  

She is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with a restaurant business; she makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She also distributes medicine to various pharmacies in Urubamba District.  Her dream is to expand to provide better service in her restaurant.  She’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients for food preparation like meat, chicken and vegetables at wholesale.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: María Nieves

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por la parroquia de Sayausi en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 48 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda economícamente, un hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María se dedica la agricultura laborando en sus propios terrenos, cultiva hortalizas y vende en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la desempeña hace 20 años. También se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos y cuyes.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus cultivos.

Su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María’s a member of the “Nuevos Horizontes” (New Horizons) communal bank.  She lives in Sayausi Parish in the city of Cuenca.  This city is characterized by the four rivers that bathe it and since December, 1999 has been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  Its residents maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

María is 48 years old, divorced and has 7 children.  Four of them are married and live on their own and one of her children works and help her out economically.  One son is going to secondary school and her youngest attends the local little elementary school in the city.  The house they live in is her property.

María works farming her own land.  She grows vegetables that she sells in the city’s market.  She’s been in this line of work for 20 years.  She also raises cattle, pigs and guinea pigs.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for six years and will use her new loan to buy manure for her crops.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha, choclos y golosinas, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de Urubamba donde vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local para que pueda vende chicha, choclos y golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor y también comprar golosinas como chupetes, caramelos, chicles y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Dominga, 46, is a member of the “Sayhua 3” communal bank that’s located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling chicha [corn-based drink], dehydrated potatoes and snacks.  She has a small stand in the market in Urubamba where she sells from 8am until 6pm; she supports her children with this business.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell chicha, dehydrated potatoes and snacks.  She’s asking for the loan to buy corn at wholesale and also snacks like lollipops, candy, chewing gum and cookies at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and also to buy snacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Marcia Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Marcia es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el sector de la Mutualista Azuay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
  
Doña Marcia tiene 40 años, es casada, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad quienes están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión Ingeniero Comercial, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

La Señora. Marcia es estilista hace 23 años, trabaja en su salón de belleza de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tintes de cabello, cremas, gel, shampú y otros productos de belleza.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Marcia is a member of the “Nuevos Horizontes” (New Horizons) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca’s Mutualista Azuay sector.  This city is known for the four rivers that bathe it and it has been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity since 1999.  Its residents maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Marcia is 40 years old and has two children who are 17 and 13 years of age and are attending a local school in the city.  Her husband is a Commercial Engineer by profession.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Marcia has been a hair stylist for 23 years.  She works in her beauty salon Monday through Saturday from 9 in the morning until 8 at night.

She is rejoining the communal bank and will use her new loan to buy hair coloring, creams, gel, shampoo and other beauty supplies.  Her dream is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Juana Victoria

texts.es:
Juana Victoria tiene 27 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos y es se dedica al cultivo de cafe en pequeña escala desde hace 15 años. Inició a dedicarse al cultivo de cafe por herencia; ya que su padre le enseñó el oficio y al morir éste le heredó una pequeña finca. 

Juana junto con su esposo trabajan diariamente desde las 6 am hasta las 2 pm. Una de las ventajas de Juana es que su finca se encuentra en una zona muy apta para el cultivo y por lo tanto la produccion del Cafe se da muy bien.

Ella está solicitando este prestamo ya que necesita comprar una maquina para moler el cafe y canastas para la recoleccion. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podra darle un valor agregado a su produccion y por tanto su precio de venta sera mejor y sus ganancias aumentaran.

Su meta es poco a poco ir tecnificando su finca y que esta crezca hasta tener una planta procesadora de cafe y asi darle una mejor condicion economica a su familia. Este es el primer prestamo de Juana y espera cancelar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Juana Victoria, 27, is married with five children. She has been a small-scale coffee farmer for fifteen years. This is a job that she inherited--her father taught her, and left her his small farm when he passed away.
Juana and her husband work every day from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm. One of their advantages is the location of their farm; it is very good for cultivation, so their coffee production is quite good.
She is requesting this loan because she needs to buy a machine to grind the coffee, as well as baskets for harvesting. The support of this loan will improve her production. Therefore her coffee will sell at a higher price and her income will increase.
Her goal is to add technology to her farm bit by bit, until she has a coffee processing plant. This will provide her family with a better income. This is Juana's first loan, and she hopes to pay it off punctually.

loans.use: to buy a machine to grind coffee.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia es cliente antigua de la institución   anteriormente trabajo en un grupo solidario las Uvitas actualmente esta trabajando en forma individual desde el año 2004 donde ese tiempo ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos con una visión de superación . La cliente vive en anticrético donde comparte  el departamento con su hija que esta estudiando en la carrera de  economía en la universidad. El crédito estará destinado para compra de accesorios de ferretería el cual tiene demanda en la ciudad del Alto en diferentes lugares donde acomoda por cantidad de acuerdo al pedido y También  comprara en poca cantidad  material para elaboración de regalos como ser platos tazas y otros donde vende en los salones de fiestas, los días sábados y domingos, la Sra. Julia se dedica a estas dos actividades, para mantener a su hija y los gastos de la casa, se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julia is a former client of the institution.  Earlier she worked with a solidarity group, Las Uvitas.  Currently she has been working on her own since 2004, during which time she has shown herself to be responsible and punctual with her payments, with an approach to improvement.

She lives in an "anticrético" [when a tenant pays a fixed sum upon renting a house instead of monthly rent] and shares the apartment with her daughter, who is studying economics in the university.  The loan will be used for buying hardware accessories, which are in demand in different places in the city of El Alto and for which she arranges the quantity in accordance with the request.  She also will buy retail the material to make gifts such as plates, cups, and others that she sells in party halls on Saturday and Sunday.  Julia works both these jobs to support her daughter and the household expenses.

She is happy about the support given.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por la parroquia de Paccha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
  
La Señora. María tiene 60 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Con su esfuerzo ha construido su casa propia.
 
Ella se dedica al comercio, vende toda clase de frutas, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 40 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo ambulantemente sin un horario fijo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar su casa.
 
Su meta es terminar su casita.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the Nuevos Horizontes ["New Horizons"] communal bank. She lives in the Paccha parish in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the four rivers which surround it. It has been a UNESCO World Heritage site since 1999. The people of Cuenca maintain their culture and traditions.
María is 60. She is a single mother of two; both of her children are grown, married, and independent. Through her own hard work, she has been able to build her own home.
Maria is a merchant. For more than 40 years, she has sold all types of fruits. She works every day of the week, selling in street markets without a fixed schedule.
She has been a member of her communal bank for thirteen years and she will invest this loan in the purchase of construction materials to add the finishing touches to her home.
Her goal is to complete her little home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth de 45 años, convive con Rodrigo de 48 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 1 hijo. Juntos habitan en el distrito de Pichari. Elizabeth es una madre dedicada al trabajo de reciclar todo tipo de productos, esta labor lo realiza en el distrito de Pichari y sus anexos. Ella incursionó en esta actividad por una simple necesidad económica, pues vio este negocio que se realizaba en la capital y por tanto quiso aplicarlo en su ciudad.  Es así que se consiguio una movilidad para llevar productos reciclables, que en un inicio el capital con el que contaba no era tan suficiente como para comprar un volumen adecuado. Los productos que recicla son botellas descartables, latas de leche, cartón y papeles, todo este producto una vez recolectado pasa a una selección, luego de ser seleccionado entra a una comprimidora. Ella esta contenta con el negocio que realiza por que le deja buenas ganancias. Mas adelante desea procesarlas, pero primero debe de adquirir equipos y maquinarias sofisticadas. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles incrementará su capital para comprar más productos que reciclar.
texts.en: Elizabeth, age 45, lives with Rodrigo, age 48. They have one child and live together in the Pichari district. Elizabeth recycles all types of products, working in the Pichari district and its annexes. She started this job out of economic need. She had seen this kind of business being carried out in the capital, and wanted to start it up in her own city. She got a vehicle to transport recyclable products. In the beginning, she did not have enough capital to buy a good amount of products. She recycles bottles, milk cans, cardboard and paper. Upon collection, these items go through a sorting process and are then passed through a compressor. Elizabeth is happy to have her business because it provides her with a good income. In the future, she wants to do the processing herself, but first she has to acquire equipment and sophisticated machinery. This will be her first loan with MFP, so she promises to repay her quotas punctually. With the requested 1,500 nuevos soles, she will increase her capital in order to purchase more products to recycle.

loans.use: to buy products for recycling.

loans.name: Sam Soom Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento SAM SOOM  Banco que ya tiene una secuencia, pero con dos socias nuevas,  esta conformado por nueve  personas la mayoría de las señoras viven el zona Tembladerani por se dedican a la venta de cd venta de artículos para celulares   otros que se dedican a la venta de ropa en el alto cual se conocen muy bien en el grupo,  también están dos varones que viven en la misma zona, La presidenta se llama Shirley ella tiene la actividad de venta de accesorios para celular y cd y su puesto en una avenida céntrica y concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz,  ella es socia antigua muy responsable, trabaja con esta actividad hace 2 años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de accesorios de celular para esta época de fin de año la Sra. Shirley es una persona joven trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank SAM SOOM which already has a loan cycle, but now has two new members, is made up of 9 people. 

The majority of the women live in the Tembladerani area. They sell CDs and mobile phone accessories, others sell high end clothes which are well known in the group. There are also two men who live in the same area.

The president is called Shirley, she sells mobile phone accessories and CDs on a central avenue that runs through the city of La Paz. She is an established member and very responsible. She has been working in this trade for two years.

She will use the loan money to buy mobile phone accessories for the end of year holiday period. Shirley is a hard working young person and grateful to the institution for the support it provides.

loans.use: to sell mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her educational costs.

loans.name: Nancy Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Nancy es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por la comunidad  Tres Marías que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi,  esta parroquia es el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio en general.

Doña Nancy tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 17, 16, 13 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente  y sus dos últimos hijos estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora Nancy se dedica a realizar la limpieza de casas, esta actividad la realiza hace un año y trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día. Por las tardes después de su trabajo se dedica a  la venta de comida rápida y en esta actividad  se encuentra hace 10 años.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para continuar con la construcción de su casa. 

Su meta es terminar la construcción de su hogar.
texts.en:
Nancy is 39 years old, married, and has four children, ages 17, 16, 13, and 12.  Her two oldest work and help her financially.  Her youngest attend school in town.  Her husband does construction work as a mason.  They own their home.

Nancy cleans houses and has been doing so for a year.  She works all day Monday through Friday.  In the evenings, after work, she sells fast food and has been doing so for ten years.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for seven years and she will use the money from this loan to buy building materials to continue building her house.

Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Nancy Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por la comunidad Tres Marías que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi, esta parraoquia es el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio.

La Señora Nancy tiene 49 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo presta sus servicios como chofer, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Doña Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos, también se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pan, carne, salchichas, papas y otros víveres para su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the community bank "Arco Iris" ("Rainbow"). She lives in the community of "Tres Marías" which belongs to the parish of Turi. This parish is the lookout of the city of Cuenca, whose people work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and business.

Nancy is 49 years old, married, and by her husband she has two children who are 15 and 8 years old. Her older daughter studies in high school and her younger son in a city school. Her husband lends his services as a driver and they own their own home.

Nancy takes care of her household and caring for their children. She also sells fast food and has been doing so for four years. She works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the community bank for four years and she is going to invest her loan in buying bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, and other provisions for her business. Her goal is to grow her business much more.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, and other provisions.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por la comunidad Tres Marías que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi,  esta parroquia es el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio.

Doña Carmen tiene 34 años, es casada y ha concebido un hijo que se encuentra de un año y medio. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y labora en el arreglo de casas, trabaja de lunes a sábados solo el medio día. En su casa también se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos y cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y en alimento para animales.

Su meta es construir una casa para su hijo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank Arco Iris.  She lives in the community of Tres Marías, which belongs to the parish of Turi.  This parish overlooks the city of Cuenca.  The people there work growing crops, raising animals, and running businesses.

She is 34 years old, is married, and has a one-and-a-half-year-old boy.   Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  They own their own house.

She attends to the household chores and works cleaning houses from Monday through Saturday, working half-day shifts.  At home she also raises pigs, chickens and Guinea pigs. 

This is her third loan with the communal bank and will invest the funds in chickens, pigs and feed for her animals.

Her goal is to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more computers.

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime is 46 years of age and married with four children.

Menime owns & operates a business venture, driving a taxi.  She has three years of experience in this business.    Menime needs a loan of WST $2000 to maintain her vehicle.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2009, Menime joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Menime's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for hamburgers and to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Amistad Del Sur Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Amistad de Sur se formo en la zona de Chasquipampa, ingresan en su tercer  ciclo después de haber culminado el segundo ciclo, esta compuesto por 8 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades. Como la señora Beatriz quien se dedica a venta de comida en distintos campos deportivos, ella no convive con su esposo ya que se separaron  y tiene dos hijos que están en la universidad, la labor que desempeña es muy sacrificada pero todo lo hace por sus hijos quienes también le ayudan con los trabajos que realizan. Ella tiene la única meta de ver a sus hijos profesionales por lo que esta muy agradecida por la confianza depositada en ella y en su asociación, la Sra. Beatriz trabaja mucho por el bienestar de sus hijos  ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia, con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de los platillos como arroz, papa, fideo y también refrescos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amistad del Sur" ["Friendship of the South"] was established in the Chasquipampa area.  It is entering its third lending cycle after having completed its first one.  The bank is made up of 8 members, who work in a variety of activities.  

One is Señora Beatriz, who works selling food at various sports fields.  She doesn't live with her husband as they are separated, and she she has two children who are attending university.  The work that she undertakes is very self-sacrificing, as everything she does, she does for her children who also help her out with her work.  She has the sole goal of seeing her children become professionals, so she is very grateful for the trust being placed in her and her association. Señora Beatriz works hard for the well-being of her children, as this is her sole source of income to support her family.

With the money from the loan, she will purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes, such as rice, potatoes, noodles, and also drinks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes, such as rice, potatoes, noodles and also drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Jose Porfirio

texts.es:
Jose Porfirio tiene 47 años de edad, es productor de cafe en pequeña escala, es casado, tiene seis hijos, y junto a su familia reside en el municipio de Patuca en el departamento de Olancho. 

Jose se dedica desde hace 15 años a este negocio y lo aprendió de familia. Todos los dias desde muy temprano por las mañanas él se ocupa de las actividades de la finca y en varias temporadas contrata a personal para que lo ayude. No tiene un horario especifico para laborar porque eso depende de las actividades que deba realizar.    

El prestamo que Jose esta solicitando lo necesita para el pago de mano de obra y para transportar al mercado local su produccion. Con el apoyo de este prestamo obtendrá algunas ganancias y asi podrá seguir llevando el sustento a su familia. 

Su meta es llegar a ser un gran productor y tener su propio medio de transporte para vender su produccion. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jose Porfirio is 47 years old.  He is a small scale coffee producer.  He is married, has 6 children, and lives with his family in the municipality of Patuca in Olancho state. 

Jose has worked in this trade for 15 years and learned it from his family.  Every morning he gets up very early to take care of activities in the field, and during different seasons he contracts people to help him.  He does not have a fixed work schedule because the work he does depends on what needs to be done.

Jose is requesting this loan to pay for labor and transportation to take his crop to market.  This loan will help him earn money to continue supporting his family.  

His goal is to become a large producer and to have his own vehicle to be able to sell his crops.  This is his first loan cycle with FAMA and he expects to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for labor and transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”LOS ANGELES;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Benedicta;  La socia tiene 54 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 5 hijos; los cuales ya son independientes; La socia se dedica  a la preparación de ceviche, este es un plato peruano a base de pescado y cocido con limón y sal, el ceviche es un plato que se sirve frio y acompañado de cebollas, tostado, choclo, camote,  ají y rocoto; la socia desea invertir en la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de este rico potaje. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para elaborar este potaje.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Benedicta belongs to the "LOS ANGELES" communal bank.  The bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and state of Cuzco.  

Benedicta is 54 years old.  She is married and has 5 children who all live independently.  She prepares ceviche, a Peruvian dish made with fish "cooked" in lemon and salt.  Ceviche is a dish served cold, accompanied by onions, toasted bread, corn, sweet potatoes, ají sauce, and rocoto peppers.

She would like to purchase ingredients for the preparation of this delicious dish.  She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients to make ceviche.

Beneditcta is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to puchase ingredients to make ceviche.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products to recycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new canoe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Jose Miguel tiene 31 años de edad, es un pequeño productor de cafe, reside en la zona del municipio de Patuca en el Departamento de Olancho, es casado y tiene 4 hijos. Él inició a dedicarse a este negocio desde hace 8 años y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien; aprendió el oficio de su padre ya que tambien se dedicaba a lo mismo. Su mayor dificultad es no contar con el dinero suficiente para sembrar una area mas grande y no tener una carro para transportar la produccion.

Jose está solicitando el prestamo para la compra de canastas para la recoleccion de cafe y para pagar el transporte de la produccion. Con el apoyo del prestamo Jose espera obtener muy buenas ganancias y con eso hacer que su situacion economica mejore.

Su meta es llegar a tener 20 manzanas de tierra cultivadas de cafe y tener su propio carro para transportar su produccion y dejar de pagar fletes. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el compromiso de sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
José Miguel is 31 years old and is a small coffee farmer. He lives in the municipality of Patuca in the Department of Olancho, is married and has four children. He started this business eight years ago, and thank God it has gone very well. He learned the trade from his father, who had the same profession. His greatest challenge is that he does not have enough money to plant on a larger plot of land, and does not have a car with which to transport his production. 

José is requesting this loan to buy baskets to collect his coffee in and to pay to transport the coffee. With the help of this loan, José hopes to earn good profits in order to improve his economic situation. 

His goal is to own 20 blocks of land on which to cultivate coffee, and to own his own car to transport his production so that he doesn't have to pay truck drivers anymore. This is his first loan cycle at FAMA, and he hopes to be able to make his loan payments on time.

loans.use: buy baskets to collect coffee and pay for transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 31 años de edad casado con Máximo de 52 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. Ellos viven en su propia casa ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Carmen es una prospera empresaria gracias a su perseverancia y dedicación constante, ella tiene una heladería donde producen ricos y deliciosos helados de frutas tropicales como plátano, naranja, mango y piña. Ella recuerda que incursionó en esta actividad gracias a que su primer hijo concluyera sus estudios de industrias alimenticias quien impulsó realizar este negocio juntamente con el apoyo económico de sus padres. Carmen antes de dedicarse a este negocio se dedicaba a las labores agrícolas  produciendo café y cacao, ahora en su nuevo negocio trabajan 4 personales mas el apoyo de su querido esposo e hijo. En un futuro carmen aspira en ampliar su producción y venta de helados. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará una nueva selladora.
texts.en: Carmen is 31 years old and married to Máximo, who is 52; they have four children together. They live in their own home in the district of Pichari. Carmen is a prosperous businesswoman, thanks to her perseverance and constant dedication. She has an ice cream shop where she produces delicious tropical fruit ice creams like banana, orange, mango and pineapple. She remembers that she started in this business thanks to her oldest son, who finished his degree in Food Industries and decided to start this business with the financial support of his parents. Before this business, Carmen worked in agriculture, producing coffee and cacao, and in her new business she works with four other people in addition to her beloved husband and son. In the future, Carmen hopes to expand her ice cream production and sales. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her loan payments on time. With this loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, she will buy a new vacuum sealing machine.

loans.use: buy a vacuum sealing machine for her business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 26 years of age and is married with two children.

Epifania owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting "taamu" (giant taro) for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Epifania needs a loan of WST $500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2010, Epifania joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Epifania's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Tanuvasa

texts.en:
Tanuvasa is 52 years of age and is married, with four children.

Tanuvasa owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Tanuvasa needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2010, Tanuvasa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tanuvasa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked goods for sale.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña María, originaria de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, vende ropa, perfumes joyas de plata , nos expresa el cambio positivo que le genero el préstamo Kiva pues gracias a este primer préstamo logro buenas ventas invirtió en mercadería variada le permitió hacer nuevos clientes. Ahora ve la oportunidad de brindar empleo a otras personas pues quiere contratar para vender plata es por ello que esta solicitando un segundo crédito comprar prendas de plata de varios estilo al por mayor y con esto lograr hacer mas clientes. Siempre sigue con sus planes construir locales que pueda rentar y vivir de ello cuando envejezca y terminar de hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
María is from Estelí, and works in commerce: she sells clothing, perfume, and silvery jewelry. She tells us that her first Kiva loan made a positive impact on her life, since thanks to that loan she had good sales. She invested the loan in a range of merchandise, which helped her attract new customers. Now, she has the opportunity to offer jobs to other people, and wants to hire people to help her sell silver. 

She is requesting this second loan in order to buy different styles of silver jewelry in bulk, in order to attract more clients. Her plans are to build business spaces that she can rent out so that she can live off of that income when she gets old, and finish her home improvements.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene una belleza que se mezcla entre la verde naturaleza y el labrado de sus campos, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres. 

Doña Rosa tiene 39 años, es casada  en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 21, 19, 16, 14, 10 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado  e independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja para sus gastos personales, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, y como pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en su casa se dedica a  la agricultura que es para su consumo, también cría  ganado, cerdos, cuyes y gallinas que son para su consumo y  para la venta.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 9 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus potreros, alimento para sus animales y ganado. 

Su meta es darles un buen porvenir a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the communal bank, Nuevo Amanecer, and lives in the Parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca.  The beauty of this parish comes from the natural green and the farms in the fields, where the residents here maintain the culture and the tradition of their parents.

Señora Rosa is 39 years old, married and has six children, aged 21, 19, 16, 14, 10, and 7 years old.  Her eldest son is married and independent.  Her second eldest son is also independent.  Two of her children are studying in high school and her two youngest study at their local school.  Her husband works in construction as a brick-layer.  They own the house that they live in.  

She takes care of the household chores and since she spends the majority of her time in her home, she also works in agriculture.  She also raises cattle, pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she sells and keeps for her own family's consumption.  

She has been a member of the communal bank for over 9 years.  She plans to invest her new credit in the purchase of fertilizer for her fields and feed for her animals.  Her goal is to give her children a better future.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, animal feed, and livestock.

loans.name: Zoila Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora Zoila es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene una belleza que se mezcla entre la verde naturaleza y lo labrado de sus campos, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
 
La Señora. Zoila tiene 40 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 20, 17, 16 y 7 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos están estudian en colegio y su ultimo en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a los quehaceres y cuidado de su hogar, como pasa en casa cría cuyes, pollos, cerdos y ganado, también trabaja en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para su consumo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 9 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio como una tienda y un vehículo.
texts.en:
Señora Zoila is a member of the communal bank, Nuevo Amanecer, and lives in the Parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca.  This Parish is known for its natural beauty and the farms in the fields.  The people here also tend to maintain the culture and the traditions of their parents.

Señora Zoila is 40 years old and a single mother of 4 children aged 20, 17, 16, and 7 years old.  Her three oldest children are studying in high school and her youngest is in the local school.  She owns the house that she lives in.

She takes care of her household and all of its related chores, and since she spends so much time at home, she also raises guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and cattle.  She also works in agriculture, which she keeps for personal consumption.

She has been a member of the communal bank for over nine years.  She plans to invest her new credit in the purchase of cattle.  Her dream is to have her own business, like a store and/or a vehicle.

loans.use: purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and she is 18 years of age, with one child.

Mary owns and operates a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Mary needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Mary joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mary's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mercy Magaly

texts.es:
La Señora Mercy es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene una belleza que se mezcla entre la verde naturaleza y lo labrado de sus campos, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
 
La Señora Mercy tiene 19 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de un año. Su esposo es empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su suegra con quien comparte los gastos de su hogar.
 
Ella pasa en casa cuidando de su hija y también se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos, cuyes y ganado a los cuales los vende en su comunidad.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos y cuyes para crecer en esta actividad.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Mercy is a member of the communal bank, Nuevo Amanecer, and lives in the Parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca.  This Parish is known for its natural beauty and its farms in the fields, where people tend to maintain the culture and the tradition of their parents.  

Señora Mercy is 19 years old, married, and has a one-year old baby girl.  Her husband is privately employed.  They do not own their own home and as such live in Mercy's mother-in-law's house with whom they share the household costs.

Mercy spends her time taking care of her daughter at home and also raises pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, and cattle, which she then sells in her community.  

This is the first credit that she is applying for with this communal bank.  She plans to invest her credit in the purchase of pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs in order to increase her sales.  Her ultimate objective is to have her own home.

loans.use: purchase pigs, chicken, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Aiga Penese

texts.en:
Aiga is 52 years of age and is married, with eight children.

Aiga owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Aiga needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 700 talas or US $292 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Aiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aiga's seventh loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila is a single woman and she is 22 years of age.

Sila owns and operates a business venture, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.  Sila needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2011, Sila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sila's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise is 51 years of age and is married, with five children.

Lise owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business.  Lise needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2008, Lise  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Lise 's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Unidos Somos Más (Junin) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unidos Somos Mas  se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y del  Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace 4 meses y  formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, comercio, entre otras actividades. Están muy contentos con la ayuda recibida con su primer crédito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  dos hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella además de ser una gran madre y ama de casa realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en la agricultura que es a lo que la familia se dedica, ellos siembran en  invierno maíz, maní, verduras entre otras cosas, en la actualidad están trabajando en la preparación de la tierra para que cuando caigan las primeras aguas sembrar y así obtener una muy buena cosecha.

Este crédito lo van  a emplear en pagar sueldos de la gente que prepara la tierra para los sembríos, adema de semillas y químicos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la forma como se trabaja en  la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener una muy buena cosecha y que el invierno sea muy bueno. 

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que está en la foto del grupo, pero, como no le ve muy bien el rostro tuvimos que adjuntar ésta foto pequeña. Los niños de la foto son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Unidos Somos Más, meets every fifteen days in the city of Junín.  This place is known for its friendly and hardworking people because this region makes the best liquor, "aguardiente," in the province and in Ecuador.  

These group of individuals decided to unite and form this communal bank over four months ago, which has helped them profusely with these credits.  They have been able to improve their small businesses because of them.  They also work in different areas, such as agriculture and business.  They are very happy with the help that they have received with their first credit.

It's here that we meet Señora Ana, who is 40 years old and married with two children, aged 12 and 9 years old, both of whom are students.  Her husband works in agriculture.  Aside from being a great mother and housewife, she is applying for this credit so that her husband may utilize with their agriculture, which is what her family works in.  They harvest corn, peanuts, and vegetables, amongst other things, in the winter.  Currently, they are working in the preparation of the soil so that when the first rains fall, they will obtain a better harvest.

This credit will be used to pay the salaries of the people that prepare the soil for the growing season, in addition to seeds and chemicals.  This is their second cycle in the Communal Bank and they enjoy it because of the way it works.  Their dream is to have a great harvest and have the winter turn out wonderfully.  

The attached photo is of one of the members that is in the group picture.  Since you couldn't see the face too well, we had to attach this tiny photo.  The children in the photo are her children.

loans.use: pay wages and purchase seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Muia

texts.en:
Muia is a married woman with three children. She is 32 years old.

Muia owns and operates a business venture selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has three years of experience in this business.   

Muia needs a loan of WST 1800 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be  $167 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2008, Muia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Muia's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is a married woman with four children. She is 57 years old.

Rasela owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business.    

Rasela needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $167 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2007, Rasela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Rasela's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Fuasou

texts.en:
Fuasou is married with three children. She is 25 years old.

Fuasou owns and operates a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    

Fuasou needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Fuasou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Fuasou's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Sevelina

texts.en:
Sevelina is 55 years old and is married. She has two children, ages 15 and 19. She has been in the business of raising pigs for three years. 

Sevelina earns 2000 PHP per month raising pigs. Sevelina also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods, soap and shampoo. 

Sevelina plans to use her loan to buy pig feed, vitamins and more items to sell such as canned goods. She hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and more items to sell such as canned goods.

loans.name: Badamkhand

texts.en:
Mrs. Badamkhand is 27 years old and sells beautification commodities, such as bandeaus and earrings, etc. She has been in business since last year and has many repeat customers already. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her business has been very successful, especially over the last several months, and she was able to buy a car with her earnings. 
Now Badamkhand needs some money to purchase lots of beautification commodities from her suppliers before the holidays. There will be a lot of sales around the markets in Mongolia during Christmas days. This is a beneficial time to increase her income for the year. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchase a large number of commodities for increasing her sales.

loans.use: To purchase a more supplies and increase her sales.

loans.name: Adulia

texts.en:
Adulia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her fishing/fish-vending business.

Adulia has been in this business for 12 years. Adulia earns more income from food vending.

Adulia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Temistocles

texts.en:
42-year-old Temistocles has been in the business of raising pigs for 3 years. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month with this business. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feeds.

Temistocles works hard for her family of a husband and 2 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Temistocles hopes to have a progressive business. She plans to make improvements to their house soon.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 57 years old and married with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid off 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Benedicta aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is 56 years old and is a married woman with a 21-year-old child. She runs a tailoring business at her home in Sikatuna, Bohol. Teofila has had this business for 21 years. She plans to use her loan to buy zippers, thread, cloth and other tailoring materials. She hopes for her business to grow and also hopes to have enough capital in the future so she would not need to borrow money.

loans.use: to buy zippers, thread, cloth and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the fishing business for 15 years. Francisca and her husband work together to improve their business and sustain their family. Francisca requested a loan to repair her fishing boat and buy fishing nets. This will help her to continue earning from their business. She hopes to have a stable income and for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat and buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Dhelly

texts.en:
Dhelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of selling food products in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more food products to sell to customers. She earns more income from frozen foods and fruits. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to buy a vehicle for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 42 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 9 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Mercidita aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nonito

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Nonito works hard to support his family. He has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from seaweed farming. He is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of his fishing boat for his  business.

Nonito has been sustaining his business activities through his past 9 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the maintenance of his fishing boat.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 53 years old and married with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

She has borrowed and back paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Salvacion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll is 47 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Cheryll has been buying and selling livestock for 12 years and also earns additional income from a networking business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 55 years old and married with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from dress making & vegetable vending. Alfreda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 60 years old and earns a living through farming. Beatriz tills her land to grow rice crops to sell. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Beatriz works hard to improve her income in order to support her family financially. She requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed. She plans to help send her nieces and nephews to school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport, pig fattening, electronic reloading and from buying and selling charcoal.

Josephine aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business.

Teresita has been in this business for 25 years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Percelinda

texts.en:
Percelinda is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Percelinda is 54 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy supplies, tools and other accessories for her sewing machine. Percelinda has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, tools and accessories for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en: Gene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her variety store. She has been in this business for 5 years. Gene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita, a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a scrap (recycled materials) business in the Philippines for 12 years, is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more plastic, metal, and bottles for her business. She earns additional income from raising pigs, shell crafting and food vending.

Benita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like plastic, metal, and bottles.

loans.name: Shijirbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Shijirbaatar, is a 23-year-old taxi driver and has been running his business since last year. He lives with his wife and his son in Kherlen, a border town in Mongolia. His monthly earnings do not meet his family's necessities and he always wants to increase his business earnings step by step. 
He decided to change his old taxi car to provide better service quality. Therefore, he is purchasing his friend's car named “Bluebird”. It is a suitable car to run a taxi service around the city. He needs 1,000,000 MNT to cover the cost of purchasing his new car.

loans.use: To cover the cost of purchasing a new car.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children, age 2, 8 and 9. She and her husband are both farmers. They till land in Talibon, Bohol, where they also live. They grow rice and coconuts on their land.

Jocelyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Jocelyn hopes for their business to grow. She also hopes to save for her children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jesily

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jesily works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Jesily is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy another motorcycle for her motorcycle transportation business.

Jesily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 37-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 18 years old. Leonora earns a living selling food items to her community. She has had this business for six years. Leonora cooks viands and banana cue (a fried-banana snack) to sell. She requested this loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, fish and oil.

Leonora works hard to support her husband, who is a fisherman, in sustaining their family. Leonora hopes to be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, fish and oil.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban, 41, owns a general store in her house in the Baray district. She sells many types of merchandise such as sweet things, snacks, shampoos, biscuits and others. Besides selling, she takes some free to time to distill Khmer traditional liquor (white wine) at home. She is a good mother of three children. She typically earns an average of $3 per day to support her family. 

Ban would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy some feed and piglets to raise in the back of her yard. She will use the balance of this loan to pay for local laborers cultivating and threshing her rice crops. In the future, she hopes to uplift her family out of poverty and to obtain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy some feed and piglets to raise in her backyard.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 41 years of age. She is married and has two children.

Julie  sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    

Julie needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 WST or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Julie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Julie's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Purev-Ochir

texts.en: Mr. Purev-Ochir is a driver in a private company. He has started his job this year in this company and has been working for many years as a driver. Purev-Ochir lives with his son and wife in the ger district, the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent Kherlen, a boundary town of Mongolia. Last fall, he started building a house beside his ger and still could not finish it due to a lack of money. He needs some money to purchase the building materials to complete the building. He wants to finish it before next autumn and now he just needs to complete some parts such as windows, doors, and wall insulation. Therefore, he will use his loan to purchase the materials necessary to build his new house.

loans.use: To purchase the materials necessary to build a new house.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with eight children. She earns a living selling viands to her community. She also sells bananas. Patricia earns 4,500 PHP per month with her activities. She works hard to support her family.

Patricia has requested this loan to buy ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, oil, vegetables and spices. Patricia hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, oil, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Frelinda

texts.en:
Frelinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Frelinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Frelinda has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Frelinda would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Tlang

texts.en:
Tlang is 31 years old and a loving father of two children, living in the Baray district. 

He is a rice cultivator and also acts as a motor mechanic in his commune. He is able to generate an income of approximately $5 per day through his businesses. 

Tlang’s wife always helps him in earning income by raising pigs. They are very hard-working because they want to place their children in good universities after they finish high school. 

At the present, Tlang is applying for a loan from HKL to purchase two pieces of farmland to increase his rice production next year. He is very thankful for the support in his business. He hopes that this loan will change his living conditions as he strives to work.

loans.use: to purchase two pieces of farmland.

loans.name: Ana Pearly

texts.en:
Ana Pearly is 36 years old and is a married woman with two children, age 12 and 14. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family.

Ana Pearly manages a coconut farm. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business and resells seaweeds. Ana Pearly is a hard-working mother. She said she only wants the best for her family.

Ana Pearly has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seaweeds and more items to sell. Ana Pearly hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seaweeds and more items to sell.

loans.name: Conielyn

texts.en:
Conielyn, 32, is a married woman with four children. Two are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Conielyn has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Conielyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other equipment for her tricycle transport business.

Conielyn has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Conielyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other equipment for her tricycle.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en: Caridad is engaged in a hog-raising business, primarily for breeding. She has been in this business for many years and earns about PHP 2,500 per piglet. Caridad is 52 years old, and lives with her children in the village of Mabini. Caridad is a widow. She says being a single parent is very difficult, but Caridad brings her best to meet her children's needs and lift her children out of poverty. Now, she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise. She hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccine, and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Viena

texts.en:
For three years Viena, a married 48-year-old mother of one child, has owned and operated a small retail shop selling a variety of goods on the island of Salua Manono. Viena is requesting a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand her enterprise.

In 2005, Viena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services, and this will be her fifth loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor is 35 years old, married, and has three children who attend primary school. She started growing vegetables and maize 10 years ago to make a living. She supplements her income by working as a worker. She now earns less than $4 per day. 

Leading a group of two female members, Sor and her group members have been with VisionFund for three years. The previous loans have helped her to have sufficient food and decent clothing for her family. Now she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy vegetable seeds for planting. This loan will enable her to increase her income to feed her family better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 53-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a tailoring business at her home in Talibon, Bohol. Anecita makes curtains, pillow cases, bags and uniforms. Anecita also provides general alterations to clothing. Anecita has had this business for eight years. She earns 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per week. 

Anecita has requested this loan to purchase cloth, threads and other tailoring materials. She hopes to sustain her youngest child's college education.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Vutha (in the photo), age 32, is a scarf weaver. Her husband, Nen, age 36, is a farmer. They have been married since 2008 and have no children yet. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vutha is requesting her first loan in the amount of $400 to help fund capital for her her husband to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his tomato and eggplant farm.

loans.use: To help fund capital for her husband to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Horl

texts.en:
Mrs. Horl is a 58-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Baray district. She has been in the agricultural business there. She grows rice crops together with her husband. In addition, Mrs. Horl owns a small store selling mixed products from her house. Now she is blessed with six children, three of whom are already married and live independently. The other three are students and live under her income. 

Mrs. Horl will use this loan to buy potatoes in bulk from local farmers to stock; she will sell them for a profit to tradesmen. She hopes that she will be able to expand and improve her existing businesses.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk from local farmers to stock.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 36 years old, while his wife, Sophal is 38 years old. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1997 and have three children, one son and two daughters. One attends school and the other two are still young. 

Vanna and his wife are farmers. They grow rice and vegetable on their farmland in the village where they live. Vanna is asking for his first loan of $400 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his rice and vegetable farm. 

Photo: Vanna is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is 39 years old, divorced, and lives in a village of the Thmor Koul district. Living as a divorced lady with three dependent children, she has struggled to feed her children by buying and selling vegetables as her primary business. She has been in this business for almost 15 years. 

Chantha and her group member, Muth, started taking loans with VisionFund in 2008. The loans have helped her to have regular income to feed her children. Now she leads a group of two members applying for another loan. She will use the entire loan to buy vegetables for sale. This loan will enable her to increase her business and earn a larger income to make a better living and save some money for her children.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for sale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 37 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 12 years old. 

Jacinta is a farmer working in Talibon, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice for 12 years. Jacinta earns 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Jacinta hopes to have enough money to sustain her children's education until college. She also hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rany's Group

texts.en:
A farmer in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district, Rany is now 37 years old and has three children who are still in primary school. She has been farming on her two-hectare farmland for 15 years to make a living. Sometimes she works for others to raise additional income. Now she earns around five U.S. dollars per day and saves around two dollars per day. 

Rany started taking loans with VisionFund in 2008. With her business growth, she and her group member Chamnan, who has been with VisionFund since 2006, are applying for another loan. She will use the entire loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. This loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and earn a larger income to keep her living standard better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, her husband also sells ice-cream when he is free from farming. They have been married since 1995 and have three sons. One is a garment worker and the others are attending school. 

Sokhon is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 buy a motorcycle for her son, the garment worker, to get work.

In the photo, Sokhon is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to get work.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 49-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has a 27-year-old child.

Zenaida has been in the business of raising hogs for 4 years. She earns 7000 PHP with this business. Zenaida also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells canned goods, shampoo, soap and other items. Zenaida works hard to support her family.
