Zenaida is requesting a loan to buy pig feed and more items to sell, like canned goods and instant noodles. She hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more items to sell like canned goods and instant noodles.

loans.name: Aveina

texts.en:
Aveina is 48 years old, married and she has 4 children.

Aveina is starting a business venture, sewing and selling clothes to local community members. Aveina needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fabric & materials. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2005, Aveina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aveina's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric & materials.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan (in the photo) is 43 and her husband, Nhoel, is 54 years old. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1986 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Two are garment workers, one is a chef, one is a driver and another one has full-time employment.  
 
Chan stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband, who is a construction worker. 

Chan is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives. She will also use a part of the loan to fill in the land in front of her house because there are some ponds in front of the house, so she needs to fill them in.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives and fill in the land in front of her house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 30 years old and married to a farmer in her village. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for over two years and has extensive experience in this business. This business brings in a good profits both to the business and the family budget. Elizabeth dreams to lift her family from poverty; this is why she works hard at her hog raising business. She also wants to provide the necessities for her pigs. Therefore, she has requested a loan of P12,000 to acquire feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold. She also hopes to grow her business to secure a good living for her family.

loans.use: To acquire feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
A 43-year-old farmer of one-hectare farmland, Srey has four children and lives in a village located in the Thmor Koul district. Due to financial hardship, her two dependent children decided to work in Thailand to support the family. She has been farming for more than five years to earn a living. She took a loan from VisionFund in 2009. The previous loans have helped her to have a regular income.

Now Srey and her group member, Ly, who has been with VisionFund for three years, are applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy rice seed and fertilizers for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
"A woman with determination and love for her parents." 

Delia is single and 51 years old. She is a devoted daughter. She lives with her parents. She is the one who provides all of the needs of her parents. Delia is the one who manages the farm. That's why she is asking a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizer and corn seed for her farm. Delia hopes that someday she can renovate her house and have a comfortable home.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and corn seed for her farm business

loans.name: Teur's Group

texts.en:
Teur is 39 years old, married and has five dependent children, several of whom are still in school. She lives in a village in the Thmor Koul district and has been earning a living as a tailor to feed her large family. Her husband is a construction builder. She earns more than twenty U.S. dollars per day and saves around four U.S. dollars per day after expenses. Her previous loans from VisionFund, since 2008, have helped her to have a regular income and to make a better living. 

With business growth, Teur and her group member, Yen, who has also been with VIsionFund since 2008 in the same village, are requesting another loan with VisionFund. Teur will use the loan to buy construction materials (i.e. cement, sand, nails, etc.) for her husband's business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her business and to earn a larger income. This will, in turn, enable her to keep a better standard of living and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Timena

texts.en:
Timena is married. She has 8 children and she is 35 years of age.

Timena owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Timena needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Timena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Timena's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. Tep is a 57-year-old widow who has been living in the Baray district with four children. To earn a living, Mrs. Tep sells breakfast to the people living in her commune from small a store behind a pagoda. From this business, she generally earns about $3.50 per day to cover her primary daily expenses. She is very diligent in her work to pursue a comfortable living. 

Presently she owns two hectares of farmland, on which she has grown some types of potato crops. And now it's time to harvest her crops because they are ripe enough. For that reason, her lands will be available to grow a new cycle of potato crops. So she decided to ask for some funds from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy potato seeds to put on her farmland again. This is her second loan with HKL and first loan with Kiva. Mrs. Tep repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to put on her farmland.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Thmor Koul district, Nat is a 31-year-old married mother of three children. Two of them are still in school while the last one has a job. She is a farmer who has been farming on her rice field for five years. She supplements her income by weaving mats and sometimes she works for others to raise additional income. She earns less than five U.S. dollars per day from her current business to feed her family. 

Nat started taking out loans in 2004. The previous loans have helped her have regular income and make a better living. Having utilized traditional electricity, Nat leads a group of five female members who have been with VisionFund for eight years applying for another with VisionFund. She will use this loan to connect the electricity to her house. This loan will enable her and her family to have electricity and also to increase her business.

loans.use: To bring electrical power to her house

loans.name: Susumai

texts.en:
Susumai is 35 years of age, married, and has six children. 

Susumai has a business selling fried foods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Susumai needs a loan of 1000 Tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand the business. 

In 2011, Susumai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Susumai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kulbara

texts.ru: Кулбаре 53 года, замужем, воспитала двоих детей. После развала Советского Союза, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Кулбара начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммы в 26,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство с коровами и баранами приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, она обрабатывает 1,10 га земли, где выращивает картофель и пшеницу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулбара обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку четырех бычков на откорм. Доходы Кулбара планирует вложить в постройку нового сарая в целях обеспечения комфортных условий для содержания скота.
texts.en: Kulbara is 53 years old, married, and has raised two children.  After the collapse of the Soviet Union, she searched for a source of income to provide for her family and started her own animal husbandry and farming business with an initial capital of  26,000 som (KGS). Today, her cow and sheep business, which allows her to sell meat and dairy products, brings about 10,000  som (KGS) per month.  Kulbara also cultivates 1.10 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and wheat. In order to further develop her business, Kulbara has requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from "Bai Tushum and Partners".  This loan will help her purchase four calves for fattening.  Kulbara plans to invest her income in the construction of a new  barn, in order to provide comfortable living conditions for her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Eleele

texts.en:
Eleele is 44 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Eleele owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Eleele needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Eleele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Eleele's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Elmurot

texts.ru: Элмурот житель района Шахритус. Возраст, 52 года. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Элмурот более шести лет занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи для продажи. Кроме того он работает сторожем по ночам. Элмурот берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Elmurot is resident of the Shahritus region. He is 52 years old, married and the father of four children. Elmurot has been engaged in crop growong for more than six years. He grows vegetables for sale. In addition, he works as a night watchmen. Elmurot is taking a loan for the purchase of fertilizers and fuel for his tractor.

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
Pele is 47 years of age, married and has 5 children.

Pele owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has had many years of experience in this business. Pele needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 750 talas or US $313 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Pele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Pele's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoun, 35, a mother of 4 children, has spent most of her life cultivating rice crops from Baray district. She has been involved in this business for ages, earning an average of $1.00 per day. Presently, the thatched roof of her home needs repair. The damage to the roof has caused difficulty for the family's living conditions. 

With the sum of KHR1,000,000 ($250), she wants to tile her roof with zinc. She is very happy and grateful to all lenders who kindly help her family. In the future, Mrs. Chhoun hope to expand her farmland and increase her rice production.

loans.use: to tile her roof with zinc.

loans.name: Omankul

texts.ru: Оманкул кредитуется в организации с 2007 года, ему 41 год, он отец четверых детей. Жена занимается воспитанием детей и производством пряжи и вязанием носков. Он занимается с детства откормом скота вместе с отцом. Но после смерти папы Оманкул самостоятельно продолжает эту деятельность.Сейчас у него несколько десятков коз и баранов, но для закупа ещё несколько голов скота он решил получить очередной кредит, так как сейчас подешевел скот на рынке. Он пунктуальный и ответственный мужчина.
texts.en: Omankul has been obtaining financing from the organization since 2007.  He is 41 years old and is a father of four children.  His wife is involved in raising the children, processing yarn and knitting socks.  Omankul has been involved in fattening up livestock together with his father since childhood, but, since his father's death, Omankul has been running this business independently.  Currently, he has several dozen of goats and sheep, but decided to obtain his next loan to purchase additional livestock because livestock prices dropped at the market.  Omankul is a punctual and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Хамрокулу 40 лет, он женат, имеет шестерых детей. Сам он пастух в кишлаке. Пасёт соседских баранов и коз за оплату. Также сам занимается и получает доход от откорма и продажи скота. У него сейчас две коровы и несколько голов баранов. На данный получаемый кредит он собирается купить две большие  дойные коровы, для получения коровьего молока, чтоб его жена могла доить и продавать домашнее молоко в кишлаке. За четыри года кредитования он ни разу не нарушал условия организации, поэтому имеет хороший моральный облик в кредитной истории.
texts.en: Hamrokul is 40 years old, married and has six children.  He is a shepherd in a village.  He watches neighbors' sheep and goats for a pay.  He is also involved in and earns an income from fattening up and selling livestock.  Hamrokul has two cows and several heads of sheep.  He plans to use this loan to purchase two big dairy cows for producing cow milk, so that his wife could milk them and sell farm-fresh milk in the village.  Hamrokul never violated the terms of the organization over his four years of financing, and this is why he has a good moral image when it comes to his credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Adylbek

texts.ru:
Адылбек 48-летний фермер, женат, имеет троих детей – школьников.  С 1996 года семья Адылбека успешно занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Начав со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Адылбек смог  увеличить поголовье до трех дойных коров и восемнадцати баранов, а также он возделывает 1,80 га земли, где выращивает эспарцет и зерновые культуры. Такая деятельность позволяет Адылбеку получать около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
 Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Адылбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Адылбек намерен использовать для реконструкции сарая в целях обеспечения хороших условий для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Adylbek is a 48-year-old farmer, he is married and has three school age children. Since 1996 Adylbek's family has been successfully running a business in raising livestock and cropping. Beginning with the starting sum of 10,000 soms (KGS) Adylbek was able to increase the headcount to three dairy cows and eighteen sheep as well as cultivate 1.8 hectares of land where he grows crops and sainfoin. This activity allows Adylbek to receive about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.

To further increase the number of livestock Adylbek has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle for fattening. Adylbek intends to use the projected profit to reconstruct the barn in order to ensure good conditions for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умед проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат. У него двое детей. Его дети маленькие. Он занимается выращиванием зернобобовых культур. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Umed lives in the Djilikul area. He is 25 years old, married and has two young children. He is engaged in the cultivation of crops. He has been involved in this type of activity for two years. He is taking a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers for sowing wheat.

loans.use: to purchase of mineral fertilizers for sowing wheat

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар женщина средних лет, мать 4-х детей, замужем и на данный момент на пенсии. Всю жизнь подрабатывала откармливая скот и кормила свою семью этим делом. Постоянно на  скотный рынок выходит сама,продаёт свой скот и заново закупает его на откорм. Вместе с ней в бизнесе участвуют сын и невестки. Мунаввар постоянно трудится несмотря на свои года и после каждого полученного кредита улучшает свои жизненные условия. Она намерена с нами сотрудничать и на очередной кредит хочет немного отремонтировать свой хлев.
texts.en: Munavvar is a middle-age woman and is a mother of four children.  She is married and is currently retired.  All her life, she worked part-time to fatten up livestock and provided for her family with this business.  She regularly goes to a livestock market herself, sells her livestock and buys livestock again for fattening up.  Her son and daughters-in-law participate in this business with her.  Munavvar constantly works, despite her age, and improves her living conditions with each obtained loan.  She intends to partner with us and wants to use this loan to make some repairs to her cowshed.

loans.use: to make repairs to a cowshed

loans.name: Dalina

texts.ru: Далина жительница района Джиликул. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. Далина занимается шитьем. Она шьет национальные платья, скатерти и пастельное белье. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки разноцветных ниток и иголок.
texts.en: Dalina is a resident of the Djilikul district. She is 21 years old. She is not married. Danila is engaged in sewing. She sews national clothing, tablecloths, and ben linen. She has been engaged in this kind of activity for three years. She is taking a loan to buy needles and multicolored yarns.

loans.use: To purchase needles and multicolored yarns

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 51 years old and is married to Amelia. They are blessed with five children. Rogelio is engaged in a hog-raising business. He raises hogs primarily for breeding.  Sometimes, Rogelio has difficulty feeding his pigs. That’s why he decided to request a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy vitamins and feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He also plans to buy galvanized iron to repair the roof of his piggery house.

He hopes to maintain his business to secure the future of his family. He will manage his business well, gain more income and save some of it for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for his pigs

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is 30 year old a married woman. She has five children, all in school. Monika has had her pharmacy in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Monika is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase drugs. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase drugs for sale.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 63-year-old married woman with 4 adult children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Corazon earns a living selling meat products in her community. Corazon cooks the food herself. She also helps her husband sell his catch at the market. Corazon does her best to improve their living situation. She has requested this loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices. Corazon hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул имеет пекарню. Она печет лепешки для продажи. В этой области она 10 лет. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Сафаргул берет кредит для приобретения угля и муки в оптом по низкой цене.
texts.en: Safargul has a bakery. She bakes bread for sale. She has been working in this area for ten years. She is married and has four children. Safargul is taking the loan to buy coal and flour in bulk at low prices.

loans.use: to purchase coal and flour

loans.name: Lavian

texts.en:
Lavian is 30 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school. She has a saloon in Yei, South Sudan, which she has owned for five years.

Lavian is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase weaves and hair lotions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase weaves and hair lotion to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 35 years old and is married with one child. She has been engaged in the hog-raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. She describes herself as patient and industrious. 

Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps her provide their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy feed for raising her piglets. 

She wants to develop her business, earn a higher income, and save some of it for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for raising her piglets.

loans.name: Chhe

texts.en:
Mrs Chhe, twenty-five, is standing next to her mother in the photograph.  She is married with two young children and lives in the Prey Chor district of Cambodia.  She is in the business of cultivating rice crops for her livelihood.  

When she gets some free time from harvesting her rice crops in December, Mrs Chhe wants to devote her time to starting up a small business purchasing and selling recycled materials.  Due to the lack of capital, Mrs Chhe won’t be able to make this project run.  Therefore, she is now taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a second-hand motorcycle to support her new business.  And with the remaining funds, she will buy and collect recycled materials.  She hopes she will be able to make a good income from this business.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a thirty-year-old, married woman with six children, all of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this investment to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a forty-year-old, married woman with four children all of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Christine is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this investment to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Mrs Hou earns a living by farming together with her husband from Prey Chor district, Cambodia.  She is now thirty-five years old and is blessed with two young children.  Growing rice crops is a big part of her life.  

Mrs Hou grows rice crops twice a year because she gets enough water from the river nearby to sustain this.  She typically earns a profit of $2.5 per day from this business.  In order to increase her profits for the whole family, she has requested a loan from Kiva, through HKL to purchase some piglets to raise and sell in the future.  Mrs Hou wants to improve her living conditions as she works hard and provide her two daughters with great opportunities to join university in Phnom Penh city.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets to raise and sell on.

loans.name: Ovadan

texts.ru: Овадан проживает в районе Джиликул. Она не замужем. Ей 27 лет. Овадан живет вместе с родителями. Ее отец находится на заработках в России. Сама она имеет средне - специальное образование. Уже девять лет как она преподает в средней школе района. Кроме того она занимается растениеводством. В этой области Овадан 11 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Ovadan lives in the Jilikul region. She is not married.  She is 27 years old. Ovadan lives with her parents. Her father is away earning money in Russia. She has a vocational education. For the last 9 years she has been teaching in the regional high school. In addition to that, she has been growing crops for the last 11 years.  The purpose of the loan is to purchase mineral fertilizer for the planting of winter wheat.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Leofe

texts.en:
Leofe is from Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte.  She is thirty-three years old.  Leofe is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Leofe runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as cigarettes, shampoo and laundry soap.  Leofe has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately PHP 4,000 per month for these activities.

Leofe is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  In 2009, Leofe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en: Adelyn, 35 years old, lives with her family in their village and is generating income through her hog-raising business. Adelyn aims to save money for future emergencies. Adelyn is now requesting a loan of P15,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy feed and additional pigs to raise and sell in the future. She believes that the loan will enhance her business, leading to a higher income upon sale of the hogs that will help to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a 40-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming for 15 years. Florita primarily grows rice crops to sell. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Florita hopes that this loan will help to increase her harvest.

In the future, Florita hopes to own a bigger farm. She also desires for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 54 years old. Myrna is married and has 4 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business of planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 29-year-old married woman who has 3 children. She and her husband have a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol where they also live. This business has been running for 4 years.

Marjorie has requested this loan to repair their fishing boat. This will help Marjorie continue running their fishing business. Marjorie hopes to acquire another fishing boat soon.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Abdukholik

texts.ru: Абдухолик житель района Джиликул. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. Имеет шестерых детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Абдухолик имеет среднее образование. Он занимается скотоводством и растениеводством. Кредит берет для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Abdulkholik is a resident of the Djilikul district. He is 31 years old, married and has six children. His children are going to school. He has a high school education. He is engaged in raising livestock and growing crops. Abdulkholik is taking a loan for planting winter wheat.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 39-year-old married woman who has 3 children. The oldest child is 20 years of age.

Beatriz raises pigs for a living. She has a backyard piggery where she raises the pigs. Beatriz works hard to improve her business and to support her family. She has requested this loan to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies. Beatriz hopes that this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman who has seven children. She is 41 years old and resides at Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. 

Caroline is operating a business venture to earn her living. She is selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She's had 3 years of experience in this business. Each month, she earns PHP4,000 doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Caroline has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Caroline wants to build a house and to ensure that her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kamwonge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past year, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her market stand, which sells fresh fruit. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruits from local farms, and will help Immaculate to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Immaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a vehicle to drive herself around in. 

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Immaculate's future prospects by helping her to learn how to develop herself and her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits from local farms

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman who has four children. Yolanda is 50 years old, and resides at Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Yolanda owns and operates a business venture, raising pigs to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 10,600 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Yolanda has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Yolanda wants to make improvements of her house and to support the completion of education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future .

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicks, chick feed, and peanuts.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 44 years old. She lives in Ijevan city with her big family. Jemma’s family consists of her husband, two sons, a daughter, two daughters-in-law, and two grandchildren.

All of Jemma’s family members are engaged in farming. They breed pigs and chickens, and grow fruits and vegetables. Also, Jemma’s husband and sons chop firewood in the forest and resell it. Thanks to her family’s occupations, Jemma was able to buy necessary furniture for her house, and to organize her sons’ weddings.

Jemma says that pig breeding is very profitable, so her family has decided to develop it. Therefore Jemma is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenia drams (AMD) to buy two new types of sows and fodder for her pigs. This is Jemma’s sixth loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy two new types of sows and fodder for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Lilian is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Lilian has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells various kinds of clothes.

To help expand her business, Lilian has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale, and will help Lilian to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Lilian hopes that in the future she will be able to have children and educate them so that they can have a bright future. 

Lilian is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Lilian's future prospects by helping her to learn how to develop herself and her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in a food stall in yambio, South Sudan for 2 years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase rice and cassava flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase rice and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 1 filho que ainda frequenta a Escola. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 21 anos no mercado chissano e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para obra da sua casa (pedra, cimento, blocos, ferro, e outro). O primeiro emprestimo foi de 21.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e fazer crescer o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has a son who still attends school. She never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman at the Chissano market for over 21 years and earns an income of about 6.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her home (stone, cement, cinder blocks, iron, etc.). The first loan was for 21.000mt, for the same purpose.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building her home and to expand her business. For that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her home (stone, cement, cinder blocks, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Xai-Xai , Provincia de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, Viuvo e pai de 12 filhos dos quais 7 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez ensino Superior e parou por falta de tempo. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Xai-Xai para Maputo em missão de serviço onde fixou a sua residência no Distrito de Boane. É tecnico agrario ha mais de 32 anos na Estação Agraria de Umbeluzi e tem um salario de 11.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutros bancos (Barclays) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 24.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (barrotes, pedra, cimento, blocos, ferro, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de 30.000.00mt, tambem para mesma actividade.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the town of Xai-Xai, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. He is a widower and has 12 children, 7 of which still attend school. He went to college and quit for lack of time. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else.
He got transferred from Xai-Xai to Maputo on a work assignment and set up residence in the district of Boane. He has been a land surveyor for the Umbeluzi Rural Station for over 32 years and earns a salary of 11.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has had loans in other banks (Barclays) and managed to repay without difficulties. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 24.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies for his home (rafters, stone, cement, cinder blocks, iron, etc.). The first loan was for 30.000mt, also for the same purpose.
He pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future he plans to finish building his house in order to provide more comfort for his family. For that reason he intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for his home (rafters, stone, cement, cinder blocks, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 38 years old and married. He is a very responsible man who has supervised his farm for 20 years. He generally earns P7,000 for every cropping. He is requesting a loan of P20,000 to purchase corn seed and fertilizer for her farm. Geraldine hopes that he can give the needs of his family in able to have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua sobrinha que vive com ela. 

Saiu de Namaacha para Boane quando casou. É agricultora, dona da machamba ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.125.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar insumos agro-pecuarios. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt aplicados para varias actividades.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir dependências para aluguer, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Namaacha, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's married and has four children, three of which still attend school. She completed 7th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports a niece who lives with her.
She left Namaacha for Boane when she got married. She's a farmer who has owned her land for over 10 years and earns an income of about 6.125mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her sixth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 20.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase  farming supplies. The other loans were for 5.000mt, 6.000mt, 7.000mt, 13.000mt and 15.000mt, for various purposes.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to build rooms for renting and for that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies (fertilizer, seeds and pesticide).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase loads of used clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is from Mitugas, Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old. Lucia is married and has three adult-aged children.

To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a business venture, selling foods in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Lucia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more balot to sell. Recently Lucia joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance as an additional investment in her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and a portion of it will be saved for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more balot to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes such as dresses, ,jeans, and footwear.

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Xai-Xai, Provincia de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

É negociante ha mais de 4 anos e vende produtos diversos onde tem um rendimento de cerca de 20.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, amendoim, arroz, peixe, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 12.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negocio , para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Xai-Xai, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children who attend school. She completed 4th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two nephews who live with her.
She has been a businesswoman for over four years. She sells various products and earns an income of about 20.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods such as olive oil, peanuts, rice, fish, etc. The first loan was for 12.000mt, for the same purpose.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to expand her business and for that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (olive oil, peanuts, rice, fish, etc.).

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is 48 years of age and is married to Nenita. They have been blessed with four children. 

Rufino is a responsible father; that's why he devotes himself full time to his hog-raising business. He has been in this business for ten years and earns approximately PHP 7,000 per head. 

Rufino dreams of lifting his family from poor living. That is why he works hard through his hog-raising business. He also wants to provide the necessities for his pigs, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for his pigs. He hopes this will make them fit and well-nourished to provide higher sales at disposing time. 

He hopes to grow his business to secure his family’s living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 33-year-old single woman with one child, who is in school. She has had a business of selling food in Yambio, South Sudan for one year.

Martha is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and cooking oil. She will use her extra income as a result of this loan to pay the school fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is a married woman, with two children. She is 55 years old and resides in Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte in the Philippines. 

Nelfa owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she has been in this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. 

Nelfa requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Nelfa wants to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 51 years old and married, with seven children. For 10 years, David has been working as a farmer and he started out by digging using a hand hoe for domestic purposes, but now he is farming on a commercial scale and even can afford to hire a tractor. He faces challenges of high inflation and bad weather patterns. He wishes to educate his children and also to buy more land for farming. He needs this loan to buy millet and beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy millet and beans for planting.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo has been involved in business for many years. He is an experienced farmer. He is involved in growing agricultural crops. Working on land is hard labor that requires a lot of effort and funds to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. Romeo wants to obtain this loan to plant corn crops and gather his harvest. Currently, Romeo is teaching the farming business to his sons. He knows that the land will always provide a good harvest if you work hard enough.

loans.use: to buy seed corn and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a married man and has 5 children. Carlos is 58 years old, residing at San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Carlos owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. He has been 4 years in this business. Each month, he earns 40,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

Carlos requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Carlos wants to make improvements to his house and to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Lenlie

texts.en:
Lenlie is 41 years old and married with 5 children.

Lenlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell. Lenlie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the firewood retail business for a year and also earns an income from a sari-sari store and farming rice.

Lenlie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a 26-year-old, hardworking man living in Hioma, Uganda. He has been running a poultry farm for 2 years now. He started the project by using his personal savings and he faces a challenge of diseases that attack the chicks. His personal goal is to build a permanent house and go back to school. He also wishes to diversify his business in the future and increase the number of birds to 200. Tony needs the loan to buy more chicks for poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy chicks for poultry farming

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her late 30's, is married with one child who is still a baby. Catherine has been running a tailoring business for 15 years now. She works from 8.00 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy another sewing machine and take care of her family and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy materials and make more women's clothes. Her dream is to one day be able to open a tailoring school.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "Torees group" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy materials and make more women's clothes

loans.name: Ubora Wa Kahawa Jama Group

texts.en:
Amos is a 44 years old, a married man with five children.  Two of his children are attending secondary education. He has been growing coffee, maize and beans for over twelve years. He is facing a number of farming problems, basically due to lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Amos is seking financial support to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his growing crops. Also he has a dream to increase his scale of production from 6 to 14 acres in five years to come, and in so doing he will be able to cover medical expenses and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 33-year-old, married woman with 5 children, 4 of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for 2 years. Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes, a 63-year-old  widow with six children, has been earning a living by pig fattening in the Philippines for seven years now, and earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ubora Wa Kahawa Jama Group

texts.en:
Helmina is a 24 years old a mother of two children, one of whom is attending primary education. She has been growing coffee, maize and beans for over 8 years. She faces agricultural problems such as lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

She is working hard to find more funds for buying fertilizers and insecticides for her growing crops. She has a target in five years to expand her scale of production from 4 to 12 acres, also to buy simple coffee curing machine together with owning private transport.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana, a 50-year-old married mother of 10, works hard to provide for her family. She has been buying and selling firewood for seven years in the Philippines and is now requesting a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell. She earns additional income buying and selling coconuts.

Luciana, who has borrowed and repaid 14 previous loans from NWTF, aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Darlison

texts.en:
Darlison is a 33-year-old single mother of four children. She sells second-hand clothes and she has been in the business for two years now. She faces a challenge of the business being seasonal. She hopes to expand her business into new markets.

Darlison needs a loan to buy more clothes to sell in order to take advantage of the peak Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicks, chicken feed and medication.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old. Melinda is a widow and has one child. 

To make a living, Melinda is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community such as shampoo, soap, etc. Melinda has been in her business for over one year and earns 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

Melinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2011, Melinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen was born in 1961; she is a widow and lives alone in Azatamut village, Ijevan area. Ashkhen's three daughters are already married and now she has four grandchildren.

For a long time Ashkhen was a worker at different factories, but since 2002 Ashkhen has been running her own shop, where she sells food, household goods and children's clothes. She says it's very hard to manage the business single-handedly, but she doesn't complain about it, and Ashkhen is very proud that she was able to bring up three children, educate them and organize their weddings thanks to her business. 

Like her first Kiva loan, now Ashkhen wants to increase her shop assortment before the New Year's holidays. Now she is asking for a 300,000 AMD loan to buy various beverages, foods, confectionery, canned food and household goods for her shop.

loans.use: to buy various beverages, foods, confectionery, canned food and household goods for her shop.

loans.name: Mbiti

texts.en: Mbiti is a 24-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is three years old. He is a sociable and talkative man. He operates a retail store where he sells spare parts. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are motorcycle drivers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more spare parts. His business goal is to be  a supplier of motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 34 years old, married, and has seven children. He has two businesses: rental houses and brewing beer. He believes his businesses are improving each day, though he faces a challenge of some of his customers defaulting. His family goal is to educate his children. His business goal is to expand his businesses to new areas.

Alex needs a loan to renovate his rental houses and to buy ingredients for brewing local gin.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses and to buy ingredients for brewing local gin.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 35-year-old single woman with one child in school. For the past five years, she has had a business selling beer in Yambio, South Sudan. Alice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beer for resale

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Taguitic, Lanao del Sur, Philippines. Jerry owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years. Each month, he earns 5,000 PHP doing this work.

He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Jerry has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Jerry wants to save money so that he has a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more beans, maize, and groundnut seeds to plant.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, a 50-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community. Her husband works as a painter.

She requests a loan to purchase more products such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her general store and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store.

loans.name: Amidar's Group

texts.en:
Amidar's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Amidar is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamwonge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past four years, Amidar has been working hard to manage her retail shop and fresh fruit stand, which sells fresh fruits, other foods, and home products to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Amidar has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruit and other food items for resale, and will help Amidar to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Amidar hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a big home. 

Amidar is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Amidar's future prospects by helping her to learn English, writing, and financial literacy.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and other food items for resale.

loans.name: Claber

texts.en:
Claber is a 51 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the town of Cortes, Bohol with her family.

Claber has been in the business of raising pigs for 15 years. She is able to support her family through her income from raising pigs. 

Claber is requesting a loan to purchase pig feeds, vitamins, and other supplies. She works hard to improve her earnings and her family's living conditions. Claber hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, vitamins, and other supplies.

loans.name: Lua

texts.en:
Lua and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 59 years old and has two sons. Lua has been earning a living by operating a general store from the front of her house for the past 9 years. She sells a variety of goods, such as sugar, candies, basic household necessities, and beverages. In addition, she sews hats at her house to increase her family income. 

Lua would like to borrow money to expand her business by purchasing a sewing machine and more products in bulk for her general store for the coming holiday season. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing a sewing machine and more products in bulk

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is 25 years old and single. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns a living operating a business of making hats at his house, which he has done for the past 7 years. He buys fabric and materials to make embroidery hats.

Phat would like to take a loan to buy better materials for his business. He hopes the loan will help him to provide better products, generate more income to cover his family's living expenses, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy better materials for his business of hat production

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим ответственный и добросовестный семьянин. Более 20 лет она занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, такие как кукурузы, пшеницы и помидор. Кроме этого он дома занимается скотоводством, а также переработкой абрикоса. Имеет хорошую репутацию и опыт в бизнесе. Абдурахим хочет перерабатывать свою землю и для этого ему нужно минеральных удобрений. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 4000 Сомони. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и поддержку.
texts.en: Abdurahim is a responsible and conscientious family man.  He has been growing crops such as corn, wheat and tomatoes for more than twenty years.  At home he also works in animal husbandry and processes apricots.   He enjoys a good reputation and is experienced in his field.   Abdurahim would like to convert his land and for this he needs mineral fertilizers.  In order to buy fertilizers, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 Somoni (TJS).  He looks forward to your assistance and thanks you in advance for your kindness and support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Munduru

texts.en:
Munduru is a 22-year-old, married woman with one child who is in school. Munduru has had a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for two months.

Munduru is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase beans and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh, 47 years old, is married and has a son. He supports his family through the income he earns from his food stall that occupies the front of his house. He sells meals such as rice with grilled pork and noodles for people in his community. His wife also helps him to manage his food stall. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Binh intends to take a loan to repair his house to provide a better site for his business. He hopes that the repairs will enable him to serve a larger number of customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and helps him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his house to create a better place for his business

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh, a 50-year-old married woman, has a son. Her husband is a merchant. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Oanh has had a general store in front of her house for 10 years. She sells many kinds of products such as confectionery, coffee, milk, and soaps.

She plans to take a loan to purchase more snack foods and confectionery to fully stock her general store. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet her customers' needs during the coming holiday season. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate additional income to reinvest in her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods and candies to fully stock her general store

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is 41 years old and married. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and a son. 

Luong's husband works as a locksmith. She earns money by running a general store in front of her house. She sells many kinds of goods such as sweets, fast food, and basic necessities to people in the local community. She has run the shop for seven years. 

Luong intends to take a loan to purchase a greater variety of general goods to sell to her customers and a bicycle for her son to go to school. She hopes that through the loan her business will bring in extra income to pay for her family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of general goods to sell to her customers and a bicycle for her son.

loans.name: Wiliam

texts.en: Wiliam is 48 years old. He lives in the village of Del Pilar. Wiliam has been engaged in his hog-raising business for four years. He usually buys pigs and sells them after they have fattened up, earning P7,000 per head. Wiliam wants to give his children a good quality of life. He also wants to provide the necessities for his pigs; therefore, he has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his pigs. He hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold. He also hopes to grow his business to secure a good living for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy, a 40-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two sons. Her husband earns an income working in a fashion design shop. Quy runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods and many kinds of rice to people in the local community. She started this business five years ago. 

Quy requires a loan to purchase a range of different products, including basic packaged foods and beverages, to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her children.

loans.use: To purchase a range of different products, including basic packaged foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en:
Thiet is 42 years old, married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works at a gas station.

Thiet has earned money by sewing bags at her house for five years. She intends to use her loan to buy fabric and materials to increase her production. She hopes that her business runs smoothly and that this will help to improve her family's living conditions and give her the ability to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials to increase her production of bags.

loans.name: Ubora Wa Kahawa Jama Group

texts.en:
Adolf is a 47-year-old father of six children, three of them attending secondary school. The other three children are earning their primary education. He is good in growing coffee, maize, and beans and has been doing it for over 8 years. He faces farming problems, namely crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Adolf is looking for working capital to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his growing crops. Also, he believes accessing working capital will lead to an expanded scale of production from 10 to 15 acres, the purchase of a grains grinding machine, and the purchase of a transport facility in five years to come.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim, 36, is widowed and earns a living to support her family by making bathing scrubs. She lives with her son in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tim started the business five years ago. She would like to take a loan to expand the business. With the loan she intends to increase her working capital by buying good materials that will enable her to make better-quality products for her customers. She hopes that this will generate more income and that she can save money for her child to go to school.

loans.use: To buy materials to make better-quality bathing scrubs.

loans.name: Prado Group

texts.en:
Alexander, who is in his early 30s, is married with two young children. He has been running a retail shop for four years. He works from 7.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the shop's stock and for household expenses and has paid back his loans successfully. He wants a loan to increase inventory and also to start building his house. His dream is to one day be able to expand his shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Prado" which has 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his shop's stock and also to start building a house.

loans.name: Janobiddin

texts.ru: Джанобиддин более 17 лет занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Его добрая жена и любящие дети помогают ему в посеве  и обработки земли. Кроме того он занимается откормом скота. Его бизнес приносит ему хороший доход, и он старается расширить его. С апреля до октября он строил дом для своего сына, все стройматериалы приобретались на полученную чистую прибыль. Он хочет продолжать и расширять свой бизнес в дальнейшем. Джанобиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота, в целях расширения скотоводства. Она надеется на вашу помощь и благодарен всем , кто поддержит его в столь нужное ему время. Спасибо!
texts.en: Janobiddin has been cultivating crops for over 17 years. He is married and has three children. His kind wife and loving children help him with sowing crops and cultivating the land. In addition, he is raising cattle. His business brings him good income and he is trying to expand it. From April through October he was building a house for his son, all building materials were paid for by his net profit. He wants to continue to expand his business in the future.  Janobiddin would like to receive a loan to buy cattle to expand his cattle rearing business. He is hoping for your help and is grateful to everyone who is supporting him in this time of need. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 30 year-old married woman with five children, all of them in school. She has had a food-stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for three year. Victoria is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung, a 35-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has a daughter. Nhung runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods and newspapers to people in the local community. She started this business four years ago. 

Nhung requires a loan to purchase a range of different products, such as snack foods and beverages to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a range of different products such as snack foods and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeung is a 40-year-old single parent who has been living in the Baray district. She has 2 single children; one works as a sewing operator in Phnom Penh and one is still a student dependent on Loeung’s income. Mrs. Loeung is a local farmer, cultivating rice crops along the river both in rainy and dry seasons. She works very hard because she hopes to obtain better living conditions through her effort, from which she is able to yield approximately $5.00 per day.

Mrs. Loeung is seeking a loan from Kiva’s funders to buy a plot of land from her neighbor. She can use the land to build her own house in the future. Her goal is to have an appropriate house for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land from her neighbor.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра умная и добрая женщина. Она замужем, любящая мать троих детей, из них двое несовершеннолетние. Она занимается купле- продажей резиновой обуви более 15 лет. У нее большой опыт, она торгует на местном рынке и имеет много постоянных клиентов. В бизнесе помогает ей её  муж, и они стараются улучшить свои  жилищные условия дать хорошее образование детям. Гулчехра хотела бы получить займ для оптовой покупки  новой сезонной обуви. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас всех.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a smart and kind woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of three children, two of whom are adolescents.  She has been involved in buying and selling rubber shoes for over 15 years.  She has an extensive experience, sells at the local market and has many regular clients.  Gulchehra's husband helps her with the business, and they try to improve their living conditions and provide a good education for their children.  Gulchehra wants to obtain this loan for a wholesale purchase of new seasonal shoes.  She relies on your help and thanks all of you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of new seasonal shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more salon equipment, wigs, weaves, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Mrs. Penh, 41, is a resident of the Prey Chhor district, Kompong Cham province. She lives with her common-law husband and has 5 children. Mrs. Penh has been cultivating rice crops for her livelihood for ages. This business provides her with approximately $1.50 per day, which is barely enough to cover her daily expenses.

Mrs. Penh doesn’t own a motorcycle for family use and it is difficult for her to go anywhere. She is therefore taking out this loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle to provide good transportation to meet the needs of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 19 years old and has a 6-month-old child. She has been in the business of raising pigs for 3 years. Fatima does her best to earn a living. She had to stop going to school because she had a baby.

Fatima has requested this loan to purchase piglets and feeds. She hopes to have a stable income that would help her sustain her baby and allow her to go back to school.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба молодая женщина 33 лет, семейная, с тремя детьми, муж Ахмадчон в данное время на заработках за пределами города, воспитывает детей одна. Занимается всеми делами: нянчит детей в свободное время, делает национальные пирожки и продаёт в школе. А дома, получив наш первый кредит купила бычков и откармливает их. Это для нее как запас на непредвиденные расходы семьи, так как продав бычков, всегда может совершить какие то расходы. Семейное условия клиента не очень-то хорошие, поэтому занимается несколькими делами. Но работает пунктуально и  расчетливо ведет свой бюджет. Уже в очередной раз берет кредит на покупку скота и очень рада, что сотрудничает с нами и той финансовой поддержке, когда это ей было необходимо.
texts.en: Matluba is a young, 33 year-old woman, married and has three children.  Her husband, Ahmadchon, currently works outside the city limits, and Matluba raises the children by herself.  She is involved in all types of work, such as taking care of the children, making national pies in her free time and selling them at a school.  And at home, having obtained our first loan, she purchased calves and fattens them up.  This business for her is like extra savings for unforeseen family expenses because she can always spend something, once she sells calves.  The client's family conditions are not very good, and this is why she is involved in several businesses.  Nevertheless, Matluba works punctually and diligently runs her budget.  She is obtaining her next loan to purchase livestock and is very happy that she is partnering with us to have this financial support, when she needs it.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Mr. Soun, 55, is a local farmer as well as a fisherman from Baray district. His spouse is shown in the photo instead because he was unavailable on the day. As usual, Mr. Soun and his wife grow rice crops twice a year because they can get enough water from the nearby river. It is now time to harvest his rainy-season rice crops and start again with his dry-season one. This loan will enable Mr. Soun to start growing his dry-season rice. He’ll use it to buy rice seeds and a few sacks of fertilizer to put on his land. He hopes to improve his living condition. He is very happy and thankful to all lenders.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and a few sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim, 37, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Since her husband's motorbike is old, Rim is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for him to attract more customers and to make more money to support the family.

In the future, Rim would like to run a new business selling groceries at home, to renew her home and to support her children to study at the higher levels of education.

Rim is not in the photo; the man in the photo is her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase stock of wheat flour, rice, sugar, beans and backing flour

loans.name: Mavludakhon

texts.ru: Мавлудахон разведенная женщина и имеет двоих детей. Она сама работает и содержит своих детей. Её единственным источникам дохода является её бизнес. Она занимается шитьем мужских национальных чапанов ( ватный стёганый халат). В бизнесе занимается сама и ей тяжело. Она хочет улучить жилищные условия и дать своим детям хорошее образование, чтобы они смогли обеспечить содержать себя и  свою семью в будущем. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки товаров для шитья чапанов. Мавлудахон надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарить вас всех.
texts.en: Mavludakhon is divorced, and has two children. She works and supports her children herself. Her business is her only source of income. She makes traditional men’s chapans (a padded quilted coat). She runs the business by herself, and it is not easy. She wants to improve their living conditions and provide her children with a good education so that they can provide for themselves and their families in the future. She would like to obtain a loan to replenish her working capital and purchase more material merchandise to make chapans. Mavludakhon looks forward to receiving your assistance and thanks you all in advance.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to make chapans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare the land for farming and to purchase maize seeds

loans.name: Vachik

texts.en: Vachik, 51 years old, lives in Geghamavan village, Sevan, with his wife. Vachik’s children are married and they live separately from their parents. Vachik worked for a long time at the Gagarin village light-technical factory and then was engaged in shoe and cup production. In 2006, Vachik began an agricultural business. He has 4 cows and some sheep on his farm. As Vachik’s wife is jobless, she helps her husband with the farming.
