Cristina; ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de cevicheria, ella tiene un puesto donde vende ceviche que es un plato a base de pescado, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local grande para que pueda vender el ceviche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pescado, verduras y platos.

 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de hotelería, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de pollos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Reyna del Carmen" communal bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Cristina is forty-six, lives with her partner, has four children, and has a ceviche business. She sells ceviche, a fish dish, from her mobile cart.  She works from 8AM until 6PM.  The business helps her bring success to her children.  Cristina's dream is to have a large locale where she can sell her ceviche.  She is seeking a loan to buy cooking supplies including fish, vegetables, and plates.

Other members' businesses include a restaurant, shoe sales, hotel management, taxi service, a grocery store, and chicken farming.

Cristina is grateful to those who are part of this dream and she promises to make all of her payments in full and on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies including fish, vegetables, and plates.

loans.name: Godelene

texts.en: Godelene is 31 years old and married with two children who are two and five years old. The oldest goes to school. She owns a boutique that she has been running for eight years. She would like to use the loan to sell more items in her boutique, such as rice, beans, potatoes and cassava. She will make savings from the profits. She would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items such as soap and dry goods.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Victoire is a 38-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of five and fourteen years old. All of her children are in school, and her husband sells a variety of goods.

For the past twenty years, Victoire has been selling cassava. With her earnings she has been able to develop her business and meet the needs of her family.

Victoire is requesting this loan so that she can purchase more cassava to sell at a profit. With her profits, she will save for her family and pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Protogene

texts.en: Protegene is 21 years old and single. He sells different items in his store. He has requested a loan to add new foodstuffs such as potatoes, cooking oil, and cassava flour. He has been selling foodstuffs for 5 years. With the profits, he will make savings. In the future, he would like to own a store.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs such as potatoes, cooking oil, and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Louse

texts.en: Louse is 43 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of three and ten. All of her children go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past 12 years. With the loan she will buy more foodstuffs like rice, cooking oil, and salt. She will use the profits from the business for providing food for her family and to make savings. In the future, she would like to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anysie

texts.en: Anysie is 43-year-old widow. For the past 5 years, she has run a business selling different items. She has requested a loan to add more items like soda, rice, and vegetables to sell. With the profits, she will create savings and solve minor problems within her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soda and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 49 years old. She has one child who is 15 years old. She sells different items such as rice and salt. She has spent 10 years in the business. She has requested this loan to add new items like cooking oil, beans and rice to sell. She plans to use the profits for saving. In the future, she would like to like to be the wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is a 46-year-old widow. She does not have children because her husband died before they had a baby. She would like a loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She has been running the same business for three years, selling beans, cooking oil, potatoes, bananas, and cassava. With the profits, she will increase her savings. Jeanne wants to see her business expand and get more clients in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, cooking oil, potatoes, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 46 years old with one child that is 8. Her child goes to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for 3 years. She has requested a loan to purchase foodstuffs such as sorghum, rice and cooking oil for her store. She will save some of the profits and solve a few urgent basic needs within her family. She would love to make her business an outstanding business for all.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, rice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is a 53 year old widow. She owns a boutique which she has been running for 4 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more inventory such as soap, cooking oil, and salt to sell. She hopes to use the profits from the business to make savings. She would like to see her business expand in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell like soaps, cooking, oil and salt.

loans.name: Marie Beatrice

texts.en: Marie Beatrice, aged 52, is a widow with 8 children who are between 14 and 27 years old. Three of her children attend school.  She has been selling foodstuffs for 10 years.  She has requested a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as cassava, rice, cooking oil, and peanuts. With the profits, she will make savings. She would love to see the business expand in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Devota

texts.en: Devota is 47 years old and widowed with 2 children aged 17 and 29 years old. One of her children goes to school. She has been running a business of selling foodstuffs for 7 years. With the loans she will buy more rice, beans, cooking oil, and peanuts. She plans to use the profits from her business for savings. She would like to see her business expand.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase food stock and quarried stone.

loans.name: Laura Leydi

texts.es: La señora Laura se dedica a la venta de comida indica que tiene experiencia de 5 años, sirve platos por las mañanas como ser caldos de kawi, costillar, brazuelo y otras variedades en su domicilio, la casa donde habita se encuentra en un lugar estratégico cerca de un mercado, actualmente  vive en casa familiar de sus abuelos en la  zona sud de la ciudad, es una persona joven amable y emprendedora el crédito que se le otorga  le ayudara  a mejorar su negocio así de esta manera generara ingresos para sustentar a su familia, con el dinero comprara mesas, sillas e insumos para la elaboración de sus ricos platillos,  la señora nos comenta que esta agradecida por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Laura has worked selling food for the last five years. She serves plates of food from her home in the mornings, including traditional stews made from beef, rib and other ingredients. The house where she lives is in a very strategic location since it is close to the market. Currently, she lives in a family home with her grandparents in the southern part of the city. She is a young, nice and enterprising person.

With this loan, she will make improvements to her business so as to increase her income and better sustain her family. With the money she will buy tables, chairs and ingredients to make more rich dishes. She tells us that she is grateful for the confidence that was shown in her by being offered a loan.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Noemy's Group

texts.es:
Noemy's Group es una sociedad de tres mujeres emprendedoras, en este grupo Noemy es la presidenta ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable en sus actividades. Noemy tiene 49 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo que es menor de edad, vive en San Gabriel en la provincia del Carchi, que se encuentra en el Norte de Ecuador.

Noemy trabaja con su familia en la crianza de pollos, negocio que le produce muy buenos ingresos económicos que le ayudan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de material para construir galpones, que ayudará a que sus pollos puedan estar mejor y más ampliamente.

El sueño de Noemy es poder tener más sucursales de su negocio ya que no tienen otras fuentes de ingresos que ayuden a satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Noemy's Group  consists of 3 entrepreneurial women.  Noemy is the president of the group, as she is very hard working and responsible in her activities.  She is 49 years old, single, and has a child who is a minor.  She lives in San Gabriel in the Carchi province, located in northern Ecuador. 

Noemy and her family raise chickens, a business that provides very good income and helps her to improve her family's quality of life.  This is her first loan with Fodemi, which she will use to purchase materials to build enclosures for the chickens, which will give them more, better quality space.

Noemy's dream is for her business to have more branches, as this is her only source of income to meet her needs.

loans.use: to build enclosures for her chickens so they have more space.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: El señor Luis Fernando a sus 28 años de edad es un emprendedor quien inició su propio negocio de venta de licor los días jueves, viernes, sábados y domingos después de las 6 de la tarde en un pequeño local cerca de su casa. Este negocio surgió de la necesidad de mejorar los ingresos económicos para poder apoyar a su familia. El señor Luis Fernando requiere de la compra de surtido con el fin de poder suplir la demanda de fin de año y así mejorar sus ventas y con estas la calidad de vida de su familia y cumplir su sueño de tener su propio mini mercado.
texts.en: Luis Fernando is a 28 year old entrepreneur who started his own business selling liquor on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays after 6pm in a small shop near his home.  This business came out of the need to increase his income in order to help his family.   Luis Fernando needs to buy additional stock in order to meet demand for New Year's.  This will allow him to increase his sales and therefore his family's quality of life.  His dream is to have his own mini market.

loans.use: to purchase a selection of liquors such as beer, aguardiente, and rum.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María integrante y secretaria del Banco comunal “Ilusión 2011” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Se dedica AL rubro del comercio, específicamente atiende un almacén, en el cual vende provisiones, frutas, verduras, carbón, bebidas, helados, artículos de bazar, entre otros.
Éste local está ubicado en el garaje de su casa, comenta que fue heredado por sus suegros, Ana junto a su marido tuvieron que remodelar el local, donde habilitaron un lava manos, instalaron cerámica, para la comodidad de ellos y la de sus clientes, por lo que se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 8 años. 
Su horario es de lunes a domingo, generalmente atiende durante las mañanas y las tardes, ya que cierra el local durante la hora de almuerzo. Los fines de semana atiende su marido y ella se dedica a la producción de empanadas de carne. Comenta que le va muy bien a pesar de la competencia existente en el sector y que cuenta con un buen número de clientes.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, supermercados mayoristas y proveedores. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para surtir su negocio.
Una de las metas en su negocio, son seguir surgiendo y prosperando.
Ana vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad, ambos asisten al colegio. El sueño de Ana es adquirir una casa propia, para esto ya se encuentra ahorrando.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios otorgados por Fondo esperanza, comenta que gracias a los créditos ha podido invertir en su negocio, lo cual le ha generado mejores ingresos.
El grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy ameno, unido y comprometido, por lo que Ana se siente muy cómoda participando en el. 
Por su parte las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender de contabilidad y conocer algunas estrategias de ventas e inversiones. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Ana María is a member and secretary of the communal bank "Ilusion 2011" in the city of Viña del Mar.  She is a merchant; specifically she has a store that sells fruit, vegetables, charcoal, drinks, ice cream, and general merchandise, etc.

Her shop is located in the garage of her home.  She inherited the site from her in-laws. Ana and her husband remodeled the site, installing a sink and ceramic tiles, for their comfort and the comfort of their customers.  She has had this business for 8 years. 

Ana works Monday to Sunday, generally in the mornings and in the afternoons, as she closes during the lunch hour.  On the weekends her husband works at the store and she makes meat empanadas.  She says that things are going very well despite competition in the market and that they have a good number of customers. She purchases her merchandise in distributors, wholesale supermarkets, and suppliers.  Some of her goals of her business are to continue growing and be successful.  

Ana lives with her husband and their two children, ages 13 and 4, who both attend school. Ana's dream is to purchase her own home, and she is saving for this.

She is very happy and thankful for the services provided by Fondo Esperanza.  She says that thanks to the loans she has been able to invest in her business, which has generated better earnings.  

The group she belongs to at the Bank is very friendly, close and committed, which is why Ana is very comfortable participating in it.  Through the training sessions she has learned about accounting and strategies for sales and investing.  

Viña del Mar is a city and community located in the central part of Chile, an area known as the Garden City due to the gardens and patios that some of the historic homes of the city have.  It is also the tourism capital of Chile.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita a sus 50 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 22 años, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de mercancía tal como ropa interior, jeans, camisetas y blusas por catálogo, esta idea surgió de la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos para el sustento de su familia, puesto que el trabajo de la confección al cual se dedicaba la señora Margarita presentaba épocas muy difíciles en las cuales disminuía la calidad de vida y bienestar de su familia. Actualmente, la señora Margarita requiere de la compra de surtido que le permita prestar un mejor servicio para sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos. Con lo anterior, la señora Margarita podrá brindarle mejores beneficios a su familia y cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén de venta de variedades.
texts.en:
Margarita, 50, is the mother of a 22-year-old son.  For five years she has worked selling merchandise such as underwear, jeans, t-shirts, and blouses by catalog.  This idea came from the need to generate greater income to support her family, since the clothing job that Margarita had been doing created very difficult periods in which her family's quality of life and well-being decreased.

Currently Margarita needs to buy stock that will allow her to give her customers better service and improve her income.  With this Margarita will be able to give more profit to her family and realize her dream of having her own variety store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as underwear, jeans, t-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Romina

texts.es: Romina, de 24 años es una joven trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su mamá Norma, su papá Oscar y sus 3 hermanos a los que quiere mucho, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Tambo. Ella es una joven ejemplar, pues realiza varias actividades durante el día. Por las mañanas trabaja en una botica, donde atiende a personas con algún malestar. Eso lo realiza de lunes a viernes, que son días de mucha saturación, pues a medio día aprovecha la buena ubicación que tiene frente a una escuela, para vender los ricos anticuchos a base de carne de pollo y corazón de oveja; que solo ella lo sabe realizar. Pero como aún estudia la carrera de enfermería por las noches, tiene que solventar algunos gastos de sus estudios y los de su familia. Por ello también se dedica al trasporte público, como taxista. Esta actividad lo realizan los fines de semana, ahí según cuenta obtiene buenas ganancias. Además es una de las pocas mujeres que lo realiza.  Su próximo objetivo es estudiar la carrera de psicología y es optimista en conseguirlo. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, y se siente contenta por ello, pues aprendió el valor de la responsabilidad, eso lo demuestra con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Romina, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de los trámites para obtener su licencia de conducir, además pronto sacará su título de enfermera; para ello también necesitará un poco de dinero.
texts.en:
Romina, 24, is a young, hard-working woman. She lives in the company of her mother, Norma; her father, Oscar; and her three brothers, who she loves very much. They live in their own house in the locality of Tambo. Romina is an exemplary young woman who performs various jobs each day. In the morning, she works in a drugstore where she tends to people with different ailments. She does this from Monday to Friday, which are very busy days since at midday she takes advantage of her good location in front of a school to sell delicious kebabs of chicken or lamb's heart, which only she knows how to make.

Since she is still studying nursing at night, Romina has to cover expenses for her studies and some for her family. For this reason, she provides transportation to the public, as a taxi driver. She does this job on weekends and earns good money doing so. She is also one of the few women who does this type of work. Her next goal is to study psychology and she is optimistic that she will achieve it.

This is Romina's second loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she feels happy about it because it has taught her the value of responsibility, which she has demonstrated with her punctual loan repayments. When Romina receives this loan she will use the requested money to pay for the paperwork to obtain her driver's license. She will also get her nursing license soon and she will need some money for that too.

loans.use: to pay for the paperwork to obtain her driver's license and nursing license

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: La señora María  de 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 6 años, la señora convive con el papa de su hijo el señor Veimar  el cual se dedica al servicio de transporte y normalmente viaja a Santa Cruz. La señora María vive en casa de sus papas en la zona Catachilla,  la señora María se dedica a la confección de ropa para niños, short y conjuntitos. El cual confecciona todos los días y los distribuye los días jueves y domingo en el mercado de la localidad de Sacaba debido a que estos días son feria en Localidad. Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa más de 5 años, teniendo así su taller en el domicilio de su papa, con el dinero del credito comprara telas e hilos para la confeccion de ropa, la Sra. María es una persona trabajadora, joven emprendedora con ganas de superación con el tiempo desea expandir mas su negocio y ofrecer sus productos a distintas lugares de la ciudad de Cochabamba y también Oruro.
texts.en: María is 28 years old and has a 6 year-old son. She lives with the father of her son, Mr. Veimar, who works in transportation and normally travels to Santa Cruz. María lives in her parents' house in the Catachilla zone. She works sewing clothing for children, like shorts and outfits. She sews every day and sells her clothing on Thursdays and Sundays at the market in Sacaba, as those are the market days in that locality. She has been sewing clothing for over five years. Her workshop is in her parents' house. She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric and thread for making clothes. María is a hard-working young woman with a desire to get ahead. In time, she hopes to expand her business more and to offer her products around the cities of Cochabamba and Oruro.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for making clothes

loans.name: Ydmen

texts.es: Ydmen, de 37 años lleva las fuerzas de una madre soltera. Se separó hace algunos años de su esposo, con quien tiene 3 hermosos hijos, que son su motor de progreso y desarrollo. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Cuando se separó de su esposo, tuvo que ingeniarse para sostener los gastos económicos de la familia. Gracias a ello perfeccionó la habilidad que hace algunos años adquirió,  “la costura”, pero esta vez de trajes típicos para danzas oriundas de los diferentes pueblos, caseríos y ciudades peruanas. Según cuenta cuando comenzó tenía muchas ganancias. Pues era la única, ahora tiene más competencia, pero ella no se desanima; pues es conocida por su buen trabajo. Los meses donde tiene mayor demanda, son a partir de mayo hacia septiembre. Su ganancias mínimas son de 600 nuevos soles por mes. Ahora ella desea juntar dinero y abrir una tienda de alquiler para obtener una ganancia extra. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, dende está segura que logrará muchos objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ydmen, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá le dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus disfraces de la danza de “trilla”, que tiene como pedido.
texts.en:
Ydmen, 37, has the strength of a single mother.  She divorced her husband several years ago and has three beautiful children who are the ones who motivate her to get ahead.  They live in their own house located in the town of Chilca.  When she divorced she had to come up with a way to support her family.  Because of this situation she was able to put to use a skill she had learned years before, sewing, but making typical costumes for the traditional dances from different Peruvian villages, communities and cities.  She claims that when she started up she earned a good profit because she was the only one in busness.  But now she has more competition.  However, this does not get her down because she is known for her good work.  The period with the highest demand is from May to September.  Her minimum profits are 600 PEN per month.  Now she wants to save and open a rental shop to earn extra income.  This is her first loan through MFP, and she is sure to meet her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  

Ydmen plans to use the loan to buy materials to make the "trilla" dance costumes she has on order.

loans.use: To buy materials to make costumes for traditional dancing.

loans.name: Yalila

texts.es: La Sra. Yalila tiene su negocio propio que es la elaboración de platos de comida variados es casada tiene tres hijos los dos mayores le ayudan en el negocio y también el esposo cuenta con muebles y vajilla propia  la solicitante anteriormente vivía en Saipina cerca a la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  por motivos económicos se vinieron a vivir a Cochabamba, actualmente vive en anticrético donde tienen instalado el negocio el crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ollas vajillas y demás accesorios que necesita para ampliar su negocio porque tiene varia demanda de clientes por su buena atención y sus deliciosos platos a un precio competitivo en el mercado.
texts.en: Yalila has her own business making various dishes. She is married and has three children. The two older ones and her husband help her with the business. She has her own furniture and dishes. She used to live in Saipina, close to the city of Santa Cruz. She moved to Cochabamba for economic reasons. She now lives in an anticrético, where she has set up her business [anticrético is a common rental arrangement in Bolivia where the renter gives a lump sum loan to a property owner in exchange for housing for a specified length of time]. She will use the requested loan to purchase pots, dishes and other accessories that she needs to expand her business. She has a lot of demand from her customers because of her good service, delicious dishes, and competitive prices.

loans.use: to buy dishes and pots

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is thirty-eight-year-old Adama. Born in Magburaka town, the wife and mother of five children is a small-scale businesswoman in the township of Magburaka. Adama’s husband is a businessman, too, and her children are all attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. 

Adama wants a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to invest in her business. She sells pans, dishes, glass-plates, cups, spoons, plastic-bowls, plastic-buckets, etc. Adama has more than sixteen years of experience in business. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business. 

Salone Microfinance Trust and Kiva lenders have contributed tremendously in the growth and expansion of Adama’s business. She was a member of a solidarity group, but as a result of continuous improvements in her business, she has moved to the individual lending category and can now receive higher loans from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy pans, dishes, glass-plates, cups, spoons, plastic-bowls, plastic-buckets, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 29 años; lleva en el corazón las ganas de progresar. Ella vive en compañía de sus padres y 2 hermanos, a los que cuida en su casa propia; ubicada en la localidad de Ahuac. Hace algún tiempo terminó la carrera de secretariado. Gracias a su habilidad y esfuerzo pudo obtener un puesto de trabajo en la ciudad de Cerro de Pasco, en una entidad del estado. Su trabajo consiste en programas de desarrollo social, desenvolviéndose como facilitador social. Con el tiempo pudo observar que tenía muchas habilidades para elaborar perfiles de técnicos; sobre proyectos de inversión social, pues trabaja en sus horas libres con los ingenieros de una consultora de la zona. Eso la motivo a estudiar la carrera universitaria de contabilidad, ya le falta poco, su deseo es ser toda una profesional. Pero como desea aprovechar la temporada de navidad, quiere asociarse con su madre para cocinar “lechones” por navidad, pues en está temporada la demanda crece de manera sorprendente y como mujer de negocios, desea obtener ventaja del mercado, para ello necesita tú ayuda. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura de progresar por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Luz, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de carne de cerdo para elaborar el rico plato denominado “lechón”.
texts.en: Luz is 29 years old. In her heart, she really wants to get ahed. She lives with her parents and 2 brothers, who she takes care in her own house located in the community of Ahuac. Some time ago, she finished secretary school. Thanks to her ability and hard work she was able to get a job in the city of Cerro de Pasco, in a state agency. Her job consists of social development programs, working as a social facilitator. In time she could see that she had a lot of ability for making technical profiles about social investment programs, because she spent her free time with engineers from an area firm. This motivated her to study accounting at the university, and she has a little ways to go. She wants to be great at her profession. But now she wants to take advantage of the Christmas season and team up with her mother in cooking suckling pigs. At this time, demand really grow surprisingly and as a businesswoman, she wants to take advantage of the market. For that, she needs your help. This is her first loan with MFP. She is sure she will progress there and for that she hopes to have your support to continue with her goals. She also promises to make her payments on time. If Luz receives your support, she will invest the money in buying various kilos of pork to make the delicious dish of suckling pig.

loans.use: to buy kilos of pork.

loans.name: Sergio David

texts.es: El señor Sergio a sus 25 años de edad es un emprendedor que inicia con su propio negocio de venta de gorras a sus amigos del colegio con el fin de poder generar ingresos para ayudarle a su familia. Hace algunos años, su hermano abrió un local y en este el señor Sergio trabaja como vendedor, a la par utiliza un pequeño espacio del local de su hermano para vender sus sombreros (gorras) y generar sus propios ingresos. El señor Sergio desea comprar surtido para su negocio para la temporada de fin de año y así mejorar sus ventas y cumplir con su sueño de ser un gran distribuidor de sombreros en su pueblo.
texts.en:
Sergio is 25 years old and is a an enterprising man who started his own business selling gorras [hats] to his friends from school. He started his business to generate an income to help his family. A few years ago his brother opened a store and that is where Sergio works as a salesman. He uses a small space in his brother's store to sell his hats and to generate his own income.

Sergio decided to purchase supplies for his business for the holiday season so that he can increase his sales and accomplish his dream of being a large distributor of hats in his town.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of gorras [hats].

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Pictured above is Ibrahim. He is fifty-six years old, was born in Magburaka town, and has five children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. 

For the past twenty-five years, Ibrahim has been selling clothes and shoes, both in wholesale and in retail. He is seeking a loan of 5, 000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to further expand his business. With this loan, he will buy clothes and shoes in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in bulk for his business

loans.name: Sileny

texts.es: Sileny de 23 años de edad es la propietaria de la Refresquería y heladería  con servicio instantáneo, como ella le llama, generada por su compromiso de obtener ingresos y continuar su crecimiento personal. Ella inició impulsada por su hermana vendiendo productos fritos en el espacio público, en un sector del centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla y cuando fue creciendo se dio a conocer; así fue como un amigo que identificó su potencial de trabajo, le propuso la distribución al por mayor de helados y la contactó directamente con el proveedor de estos. De esta manera entre los dos tomaron en arriendo un local,  y con un capital de trabajo que le regaló su padre,  decidió con su amigo, abrir un punto que refrescara a la gente y que le produjera dinero para el sustento personal. Posteriormente compró dos computadores de segunda, e inició su nuevo servicio de internet, transcripciones y finalmente fotocopiaje. Una de los desafíos más grandes, que ha tenido que enfrentar Sileny,  es haber abandonado sus estudios universitarios, pues su mamá de profesión enfermera,  tuvo quebrantos de salud  y no pudo continuar trabajando. Con su negocio aspira en un futuro, continuar con su carrera y lograr los éxitos con los que siempre,  como mujer joven ha soñado. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primero que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  refrescos, mecatos, papelería en general.  Con esta inversión  tendrá éxito, porque cuenta con un mercado permanente, porque está ubicada en un lugar cercano a las universidades y a muchas residencias, que generan clientes jóvenes  y su inversión la hará sobre los productos de mayor rotación en su negocio, que son los que este mercado compra.
texts.en:
Sileny, 23, is the owner of a convenience store selling soft drinks and ice creams with what she calls “instant service.” She is driven by her commitment to earn income and continue her personal growth.

Encouraged by her sister, she started selling fried foods to the public, in an area of downtown Barranquilla. As her business grew, it started to become well-known. As a result, a friend, who saw the potential for her business, proposed distributing ice cream wholesale and put her directly in touch with a supplier. Between Sileny and her friend, they rented a building. With working capital that her father gave her, Sileny and her friend decided to open a place that would produce money so that they could support themselves and where people could come to be refreshed. Later, Sileny purchased two second-hand computers and started an additional business, providing internet service, transcriptions, and photocopying services. 

One of the greatest challenges that Sileny has had to face was having to abandon her university studies. Her mother, who is a nurse by trade, fell ill and was not able to continue working. With her business, Sileny aspires to continue her education and achieve the successes that she always dreamed about as a young woman.

At present, she is applying for her first Kiva loan, which is also her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will purchase soft drinks, snacks, and general stationery supplies. She will have success with this investment because she has a permanent marketplace. Her business is located near the universities and residential areas, which generate many young customers. She will invest in purchasing items that sell most quickly, because these are what her customers buy.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, snacks and general stationery items.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 32 años de edad, convive con Jeremías de 30 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Norma, es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su negocio en la venta de golosinas. Esta actividad lo realiza en el mercadito de su ciudad, que con el apoyo de sus hijos pudo estabelcerse, al principio no tenia mucha clientela, pero poco a poco fue ganándose el aprecio de ellos en especial de los más pequeños quienes son sus clientes potenciales. Norma está feliz por que el negocio le va muy bien gracias al empeño que tiene para con ello. En un futuro desea abrir un nuevo negocio en la venta de abarrotes para así obtener mejores ingresos y darles una mejor vida a su familia. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles norma comprará productos de primera necesidad para abrir su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old and lives with Jeremiah who is 30.  They have three children. They live together in their own home located in the district of Pichari. 

Norma is a woman dedicated to her family and her business selling sweets. Her business takes place in the small market of their city.  With the support of her children she was able to establish herself in the business.  At first she did not have much business, but has gradually gained the appreciation of her clientele, especially the little ones who are her best potential customers. Norma is happy because business is doing very well thanks to her efforts

She wants to open a new business selling groceries in order to obtain better profits and offer a better life for her family. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her loan payments punctually.  With the 1,500 soles, Norma will buy standard grocery staples to open her new business.

loans.use: To buy products to provision her store

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three children who go to school.  She has been running a business selling clothes for 4 years now. She works from 8.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory and has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants a loan to buy a good stock of clothes to sell during Christmas time.  Her dream is to one day be able to own a boutique and also sell M-pesa.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "Singinda," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the stock of clothes.

loans.name: Katherine Yuliana

texts.es:
Katherine trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
Katherine es una mujer casada de 22 años , tiene un hijo de 6 meses, ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa de vestir, eligio este oficio porque le parece que es muy rentable porque le genera ingresos, Katherine es una mujer responsable y muy luchadora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, empezó en el negocio hace 1 año, gana semanalmente un promedio de S/. 250.00 soles.
Con el crédito que le otorgará Kiva de S/. 1500.00 soles, lo invertirá para la compra de mercadería (pantalones. Polos, etc) uno de sus sueños es tener su propio local para la venta de ropa , su analista cree que es un excelente cliente y que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Katherine works in Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Katherine, 22, is married and has a sixth month old child. She works buying and selling clothing. She chose this job because it seemed very profitable and would generate income. Katherine is a very responsible and hard working woman with a strong desire for her family to get ahead. She started in this business one year ago, and makes an average of 250 PEN each week.

With the loan of 1,500 PEN, she will invest in merchandise (pants, polos, etc.). One of her dreams is to have her own store to sell clothes. Her loan officer believes that she is an excellent client and will make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy pants, polos and shirts.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda de 37 años, esta casado con Alberto de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 04 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Yolanda, es consecuente con sus ideas, trabajadora y muy creativa, tiene un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras. Incursionó en éste negocio gracias al impulso de sus vecinos quienes la incentivaron a formar parte de la junta de vecinos que tienen su puesto en el mercado de su ciudad. Entonces accedió a un puesto donde ahora expende frutas y verduras. Generalmente trabaja sola pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo y esposo. Yolanda está feliz y agradecida con sus vecinos por lo que gracias a ello viene obteniendo buenas ganancias así podrá cubrir algunas necesidades primordiales en la familia, cosa que antes el dinero que percibía su esposo no era tan suficiente razón por la que ella decidió realizar este negocio. 
Yolanda en un futuro piensa en mejorar su establecimiento y tener mas mercadería. Este será su primer credito por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará más mercaderías entre frutas y verduras.
texts.en: Yolanda is 37 and married to Alberto, 40. Their marriage produced 4 children. They live together in their own house located in the Pichari district. Yolanda is very principled person, hardworking and creative. She has a fruit and vegetable stand. She started this business thanks to the encouragement of some neighbors, who incentivized her to become a part of their group that has stalls in their local market. Then she got a post where now she sells her fruits and vegetables. She usually works alone but sometimes receives help from her son and husband. Yolanda is happy and thankful for her neighbors, because thanks to them she now has a good income and can pay for her family's basic needs. Before, the money that her husband made was not sufficient, which is why she decided to start this business. In the future, Yolanda plans to improve her establishment and have more merchandise. This will be her first loan, and she promises to make payments on time. With the 1,500 PEN, she will buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Joseph S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT and Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 10,600,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will use their salaries to repay the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment amount from their salaries and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Joseph (who is pictured second from right) is the leader of this group of teachers. The 33 year old was born in Magburaka. He is married to a teacher and the couple has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. Joseph has been a professional teacher for 15 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials like bags of cements, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like bags of cements, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: La señora Otilia a sus 49 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos por los cuales tiene que velar sola puesto que su esposo murió hace poco. Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para sostener a su familia, la señora Otilia desea emprender su propio negocio de venta de ropa informal para dama y caballero desde su casa. La señora Otilia requiere de la compra surtido para iniciar a trabajar y así poder generar los ingresos para su hogar. El sueño de la señora Otilia es tener su propio almacén y mejorar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Otilia is a 49-year-old mother of four children for whom she has to care for alone since her husband recently died.  With the aim to generate income to support her family, Mrs. Otilia wants to start her own business selling casual clothes for men and women from her home. Mrs. Otilia needs to purchase an assortment of clothing to start to work and thus to generate income for her home. Mrs. Otilia's dream is to have her own store and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of clothing in order to start her business.

loans.name: Guido Daniel

texts.es: Guido  con su primer credikiva compró materiales y reparó electrodomésticos,  que tenía pendiente por hacer, así respondió más rápidamente a su clientela y reinvirtió sus utilidades. Desde que recibió su credikiva pudo comprar de contado, adquirir descuentos que  trasladó al costo de sus productos e incrementó sus ganancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para producir bovinas y en repuestos para reparar muchos más abanicos, que es su especialidad. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su vivienda agregándole a ella su taller.  Guido envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: Gracias por la oportunidad de recibir un crédito a un bajo costo. “
texts.en: With his first Kiva loan, Guido purchased materials and repaired household appliances, responding more quickly to his customers, and he reinvested is profits. Since then he was able to pay in cash and receive discounts on his products, and increased his profits. He is currently requesting another Kiva loan, which he plans to invest in the purchase of materials to make coils and spare part to repair many more fans, which is his specialty. His goal in the future is to add a workshop to his home. Guido sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the opportunity to receive the loan at a low cost."

loans.use: purchase materials to make coils and spare parts to repair fans.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yolanda a sus 61 años es una gran comerciante quien se ha dedicado toda su vida a esta labor, actualmente labora desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m desde su casa o de acuerdo a los requerimientos de sus clientes. La señora Yolanda es una persona sola por lo cual debe trabajar para conseguir los ingresos para su propio sustento. La señora Yolanda requiere de la compra de mercancía para cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes le han hecho para esta temporada de fin de año. El sueño de la señora Yolanda es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en: Yolanda, 61, is a great merchant who has dedicated her whole life to this trade. She currently works from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m. from her home or wherever her customers require. Yolanda is single, so she must work to earn money and be self sufficient. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies to fulfill her customers' orders for the end of the year. Her dream is to have her own warehouse.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like undergarments for men and women.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una madre soltera que se dedica a criar ganado vacuno, es así como obtiene el dinero suficiente para poder cuidar y darle todo lo que necesita a su pequeño hijo de 3 años, juntos viven en la ciudad de Camaná, ubicada al sur del país, ciudad que disfruta a diario del Océano Pacífico, debido a que se encuentra a pocos metros de la ciudad. Vilma es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa a la que le encanta tejer ropa durante sus tiempos libres; como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Vilma más le gusta son las “Lentejitas”.		
	
Vilma se ha dedica a la  crianza de ganado vacuno por muchos años, ella empezó ayudando a sus padres en la crianza de los animales, es así como ella empieza a conocer en detalle la manera en que se deben realizar las comprar y ventas de los productos para que con el tiempo ella se dedique exclusivamente a este negocio.  Los ingresos que obtiene de este negocio le permiten cubrir todos los gastos que ella tiene, Vilma se dedica aproximadamente 10 horas diarias a su ganado, estos son vendidos después de algún tiempo porque primero deben desarrollarse lo suficiente para realizarse la venta de los mismos, es por esto que Vilma opto por dedicarse también a la venta de cosméticos a través de catálogos para generar ingresos y juntarlo a sus ahorros obtenidos en la venta de sus animales por temporadas.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Vilma podrá comprar alimentos de mejor calidad que son necesarios para su ganado, esto le permitirá mejorar la crianza de sus vacas y es así como logrará los ingresos que desea para que más adelante pueda  mejorar el estado de su casa.
texts.en: Vilma is a single mother who makes a living raising cattle. This is how she makes enough money to care and provide for everything her 3-year-old son needs. They live in the city of Camaná, in the south of Peru right off the Pacific Ocean. Vilma is a hard-working woman who loves to weave clothing during her free time. It is well known that Peru has some of the most delicious food in the world, and one of the dishes that Vilma likes the most is "Lentejitas." Vilma has raised cattle for many years. She started out helping her parents with the animals, and that's how she came to know in detail how to make her purchases and sales so that in time she can dedicate herself exclusively to the business. With the money she makes she is able to cover all of her expenses. She works approximately 10 hours a day with her cows, which she sells after they have reached a certain level of development. This is why Vilma also makes a living selling cosmetics via catalog to generate extra income to go with her savings from raising livestock. With the help of Kiva lenders, Vilma plans to purchase high-quality feed, which will help her better raise her cows and in this way improve her income in the future so that she can make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Elda Soray

texts.en:
Elda is 40 years old and resides in Cofradía, a town located on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula. Elda is single and doesn't have any children. For the past two years, she's been running a pulpería where she sells trinkets and groceries like soda, dairy products, meat, snacks (chips and cookies), fruits and bread. Her grocery store is open seven days a week and she attends clients from eight a. m. to 11 p. m. 

Over the years, Elda has invested her time and money in the pulpería, which has allowed it to grow steadily. Elda will use this 15,000 Lempira (HNL) loan from ODEF to increase her inventory with the purchase of soft drinks, snack foods and dairy products. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and that her quality of life will continue to improve.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, snack foods, and dairy products.

loans.name: Alira

texts.es: Alira, de 58 años, es mujer amable y trabajadora. Esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Ella vive a lado de su esposo en una casa propia desde donde dieron educación a sus hijos y en donde comparte sus días a lado del hombre que le dio todo y ella ayudo en todo para progresar juntos. El trabajo de Alira consiste en la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, de manera mensual trae de la ciudad de Lima mucha variedad de prendas de vestir, acá se encarga de venderlos entre sus amigos y vecinos quienes siempre están a la expectativa de las cosas que trae ya que siempre son de muy buena calidad y están muy a la moda. Asimismo se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cosméticos, perfumería y otros de uso personal. Todo este trabajo lo hace en su casa y está muy contenta de ver que el negocio que empezó de a poco hace cuatro años ahora esta dando buenos resultados. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite tener ingresos a la economía de su hogar, además ahora no tiene que esperar de nadie para poder tener sus propios ingresos. Ahora esta muy tranquila ya que es independiente, desea mantenerse como esta yendo hasta ahora y poder seguir trabajando en busca de un mejor futuro. Este será el crédito número tres con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Esta muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mercadería en mayor cantidad, además empezará con la venta de lencería fina.
texts.en: Alira, 58, is a very friendly and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children who are grown up and independent. She lives with her husband in their own home where they educated their children and where they share their days side by side making progress together. Alira sells beauty products and clothing. Every month she brings a wide variety of garments from the city of Lima, which she then sells to her friends and neighbors who are always waiting for the things she brings since they are of high quality and stylish. She also makes a living selling beauty products like cosmetics, perfumes and other personal-use items. She does all this work from her home and is very content to see her business that she started four years ago is now showing good results. She really enjoys what she does because it allows her to add to the household finances. Now she feels very calm because she is independent and she wants to keep going and continue working in search of a better future. This will be her third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes to continue with her objectives. She once again promises to make her payments on time as she has done in the past. She is very content to be a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible and stick together. With the loan, she plans to purchase supplies in bulk, and she plans to start selling fine lingerie.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, lingerie and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 61 años de edad es sus condiciones de mujer separada, educó a 4 hijos que hoy están en las edades de 22 a 33 años. Es propietaria  de un taller donde produce muebles que comercializa a través de tres vendedores por toda la ciudad y mediante la modalidad de crédito, cuyos pagos lo hacen sus clientes en  cuotas semanales. En su negocio maneja las líneas de escaparates, multiusos,  comedores  en madera,  entre otros. Cuando inició esta experiencia de trabajo, lo hizo asociada con pintores ebanistas de un barrio al Suroccidente de la ciudad, con quienes trabajó  alrededor de 4 años, para luego iniciar su propia aventura de trabajo independiente en el barrio donde actualmente  vive. Ella tiene en su vivienda el taller y su mayor desafío es ponerle una cubierta y adecuarlo para trabajar más confortablemente. Su sueño de crecimiento empresarial es evidente  y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  invertirá en la adecuación del local comercial en su techo y en las paredes, con los que se propone ofrecer un ambiente confortable y a sus clientes, para que en esta temporada de Diciembre puedan ver su exhibición sin ningún inconveniente de espació estrecho, como el que le venía ofreciendo.
texts.en: Ana is 61 years old and is separated from her husband. She raised four children who today are between the ages of 22 and 33. She owns a workshop that produces furniture that she sells on credit to three vendors throughout the city, and they make payments to her every week. At her business she manages the displays, multiuse items, wooden dining tables and other items. When she started working, she associated with painters and cabinet makers from a barrio in the southwest of the city, whom she worked with for around four years. She then started her own business venture in the neighborhood where she currently lives. She has a workshop in her home and her biggest challenge is to cover it and make it more comfortable. Her dream of growing as a businesswoman is evident, and that is the reason she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to invest in setting up her workspace with a roof and walls to offer her and her clients a more comfortable environment, so that during this time of December they can see her offering without and inconvenience of tight spaces, like it has been.

loans.use: to invest in setting up her workspace with a roof and walls.

loans.name: Eduardo Aquiles

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre soltero de 25 años de edad, el se dedica al oficio de transporte , le gusta este oficio porque le genera ingresos, Eduardo es un hombre trabajador, honesto y muy luchador con muchas ganas de salir adelante, el empezó en el negocio hace 2 años, gana un promedio de S/. 220.00 soles semanales.
Eduardo trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
Con el crédito que le otorgará Kiva por el importe de S/ 1000.00 soles lo invertirá  para darle mantenimiento general  a su mototaxi, uno de sus desafíos diarios que tiene que enfrentar es la competencia, uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa para que en un futuro no muy lejano tenga una mejor calidad de vida, su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar sus cuotas las fechas indicadas.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a single, 25 year-old man who works in transportation.  He likes this trade because he can generate an income.  Eduardo is a hardworking and honest man who is very tenacious, and has a strong desire to get ahead.  He started his business 2 years ago, and he earns an average of 220 Peruvian soles per week. 

Eduardo works in Ica, Peru.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.  

With the loan that Kiva will grant him of 1,000 Peruvian soles, Eduardo will invest in general maintenance work for his mototaxi.  One of his daily challenges is that he faces a lot of competition.  One of his dreams is to have his own house so that in the not so distant future he could have a better quality of life.  His loan officer believes that he is a good client, and that he will make all of his payments by the due dates.

loans.use: to do general maintenance work on his mototaxi

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
María Ester integrante del Banco comunal “Héroes del Mar 2” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida rápida en un local que tiene ubicado en la orilla de una calle principal, cercana a su casa.
En este local cuenta con refrigerador, microondas, freidora, mesones, bandejas y fogones, entre otros. Ahí vende bebidas, pizzas, papas fritas, completos y churrascos. 
Trabaja en este negocio desde hace dos años. Su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a sus necesidades, por las mañanas realiza las compras de mercadería, durante las tardes preparara sus alimentos y durante las noches, abre su local para atender y vender sus productos.
Comenta que le va muy bien y que distribuye sus horarios de acuerdo a sus necesidades personales.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas y en el mercado de la ciudad.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su negocio, entre sacos de papas, aceite, envases de plumavit y bebidas al por mayor. Siempre escoge lugares y comercios, donde los precios sean más convenientes.
Una de las metas para su negocio, es comprarse un vehículo para trasladar sus productos al local o cuando debe comprar mercadería.
María Ester vive junto a su marido y su hija de 2 años de edad, su marido es quien la ayuda con la crianza y cuidado de su pequeña hija, cuando ella debe trabajar. Sus sueños a nivel personal son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, ya que le han permitido invertir en su negocio e integrar nuevas y mejores estrategias en el área de ventas. 
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que son muy unidos y comprometidos. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
María Ester is a member of the “Héroes del Mar 2” [Heroes of the Sea] community bank, in the city of Valparaíso. She makes her living by preparing fast foods in a shop she has located near a main street, close to her house. At this shop, she has a refrigerator, microwave, fryer, counters, trays, and stoves, among other things. She sells drinks, pizzas, French fries, completos [Chilean style hotdogs with lots of toppings], and barbeque. 

She has been in this business for the past two years. She sets her work schedule according to her needs. In the mornings, she purchases merchandise; during the afternoon, she prepares food; and at night, she opens her shop to serve people and sell her products. She comments that things are going very well for her, and that she is able to arrange her schedule according to her personal needs. She purchases merchandise in wholesale supermarkets and in the city market.

With the loan, she will purchase foodstuffs wholesale, including sacks of potatoes, oil, Styrofoam containers and drink. She always chooses stores where the prices are most convenient. One of her business goals is to purchase a vehicle to transport her foods to the shop and to use for purchasing merchandise.

María Ester lives with her husband and her 2-year-old daughter. Her husband helps her raise and care for their small daughter while María Ester is working. Her personal dream is to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She is very pleased and appreciative of the services provided by Fondo Esperanza, as they have allowed her to invest in her business and to incorporate new and better sales strategies. Regarding the communal bank group of which she is a part, María Ester comments that they are very united and committed.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and the seat of legislative power in the country. It is the main port of the nation and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, like, for example, the house of the Nobel Prize-winning poet, Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise for her business, including sacks of potatoes, oil, Styrofoam containers and drinks.

loans.name: Milena Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Milena , habita en la comarca Los Encuentros localizada en Yalaguina municipio de Estelí,  tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos , ella es de oficio comerciante , vende ropa usada ambulante lleva 6 años con este negocio. Su esposo la apoyo con la idea de comenzar a vender ropas usada así aportar a su hogar y ganar su propio dinero y ser mas independiente su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad y con lo que gana aporta al hogar para suplir los gastos y ella ayuda a sus hijos con los estudios de esta manera en conjunto se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante como familia.
Realizo el crédito para comprar de ropa nueva de diferentes estilos y medidas para dama y caballeros. Ya que desea ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y surtir un poco su venta de mercadería en general. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta hacer reparaciones en su vivienda pero s meta próxima es preparar a su hija que esta en la universidad buscando un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Milena lives in Los Encuentros district, located in Yalaguina, in the city of Estelí. She is 40 years old, married and has three children. She has had a business selling used clothes on foot for 6 years. Her husband helped her with the idea of starting to sell used clothes in order to support their household, earn her own money, and be more independent. Her husband works as a security guard, and with what he earns, he supports the household by covering expenses. She helps their children with their studies, so together they support each other to make progress as a family. 

She took the loan to buy new clothes with different styles and sizes for both men and women, since she wants to offer variety to her customers and increase her sales of merchandise in general. Her future plans include make repairs in her home, but her short-term goal is preparing her daughter who is in college to seek a better future.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Flor De Viento Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE VIENTO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elena. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, servicios, venta de aceite y limpieza, 

La señora Elena,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una asesora de crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de aceite que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de aceite) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The community association "Wind Flower"  begins its first cycle with Pro Mujer through the regional office Santiago II.  It consists of eight members and is led by a committee headed by Mrs. Elena.  The members are involved in various businesses, including: trade, production, services, sale of olive oil and cleaning.

Mrs. Elena, indicates that it is their first time working with Pro Mujer and began with the institution at the invitation of a credit counselor. She has a business selling olive oil that has been functioning for some time.

The credit will allow her to raise capital (for the purchase of oil), which she will acquire in Ceja wholesale and subsequently market in fairs. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she lives in a civil union and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in credit and health.

loans.use: to purchase olive oil

loans.name: Lucely

texts.es: La señora Lucely a sus 48 años de edad es madre cabeza de familia, vela por su hijo y se dedica desde hace más de 18 años a la venta de comidas rápidas y fritos. La señora Lucely requiere de la compra de insumos para elaborar sus productos y comercializarlos, adicionalmente realizar adecuaciones en el piso y paredes de su local donde vende los productos que esta localizado a la orilla del rio Medellín. La señora Lucely espera mejorar sus ingresos y con estos la calidad de vida de su familia y cumplir su sueño de comprar una casa propia para que su hijo tenga asegurado donde vivir.
texts.en: Lucely, 48, is a mother and head of household.  She cares for her son, and for more than 18 years she has had a business selling fried fast food.  Lucely needs to buy supplies to make her products and sell them.  In addition, she needs to make some repairs to the floor and wall of the premises where she sells her products, located on the bank of the Medellín river.  Lucely hopes to improve her income and with it the quality of life of her family, and to fulfill her dream of buying her own house so that her child can be assured of a place to live.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, cooking oil and vegetables, and also to make some repairs to the floor and walls of her business premises

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es: Dalia, de 21 años, es una mujer buena y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un bebe de 8 meses de nacido quien es la razón de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo para poder brindarle una vida saludable y mas adelante una buena educación, ellos viven en casa de su madre y juntos realizan grandes esfuerzos para así progresar. El trabajo de Dalia consiste en la venta de ropa, de manera mensual, un familiar le envían de la ciudad de Lima ropa en grandes cantidades, para que ella acá se encargue de colocarlos entre sus clientes quienes en su mayoría son familiares, amigos y vecinos. Todo lo realiza en su casa y algunas veces se va a casa de sus clientes en busca de ofrecer su variedad de prendas que siempre son de buena calidad y a la vanguardia de la moda. Lleva realizando este trabajo por un año y le esta permitiendo generar ingresos en su hogar a diferencia de antes que solo tenía que esperar que su conviviente le de algo para sus cosas personales, desde que trabaja con este negocio puede disponer de su propio dinero y aportar a la economía de su hogar. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite disponer de su tiempo y así poder cuidar a su bebe quien a su edad necesita todos los cuidados necesarios que le puede brindar su madre, ahora se esta proyectando a armar su campaña navideña y así poder duplicar sus ingresos a través de sus ventas. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado ella se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior que tuvo. Se siente muy a gusto de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son personas responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más ropa y así poder vender en este mes que es cuando más aumenta la producción de su actividad.
texts.en:
Dalia, 21, is a good, hard-working woman.  She is living with her partner, with whom she has an 8-month-old baby.  Her child is the reason for this effort and work. She wants to provide him with a healthy life and good education.  They live in her mother's house and together make a large effort in order to progress.  

Dalia's work consists of clothing sales on a monthly basis.  A relative, from the city of Lima, sends her clothing in large quantities, so that she can handle the placement among her clients, most of whom are relatives, friends, and neighbors.  She does everything in her house and sometimes goes to her clients' homes seeking to offer a variety of clothing, which are always of good quality and at the forefront of fashion.  

She has been doing this work for one year. It has allowed her to generate income in her home, unlike before when she had to wait for her partner to give her personal things.  Since working with this business she can have her own money and provide toward the economy of her home.  She loves what she does because it allows her to use her time and care for her baby, who, at this age, needs all the care his mother can give.  

She is now projecting to build her business for the holiday season so that she can duplicate her income through her sales.  This will be her second loan with MFP.  She is waiting for this small loan so that she can meet her goals.  On the other hand, she agrees to be punctual in her repayment, as she was with her previous loan.  She feels very comfortable belonging to her community bank since they are very responsible and supportive people.  With the amount requested (1,500 soles), she will purchase more clothing and be able to sell it this month when activity increases.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es: La Sra. Amelia  es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar  y  tiene 27 años de edad,  actualmente es socia  en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres del Sol” grupo  conformado por 15  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Amelia trabaja en una bodega donde vende abarrotes, dulces, gaseosas, y lo inauguró hace 8 meses, este trabajo surge a raíz de que su primer hijo entra al colegio por primera vez  y es así su deseo de brindarle lo mejor  a sus hijos  y su deseo de superación de Amelia, Su sueño de Amelia es tener una bodega más grande y  vender al por mayor, Amelia agradece a Edaprospo y kiva por que fue quien le dio su primer prestamo para tener su negocio . Sabemos que Amelia cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Amelia lives with her partner. She has two school-aged children and she is 27 years old.  She is a member of the "Mujeres del Sol" (Women of the Sun) communal bank which has 15 members who have diverse businesses.  

Amelia has a shop where she sells groceries, candy, and soft drinks.  She started her business 8 months ago when her first son started school.  She wants to provide the best to her children and get ahead.  Amelia's dream is to have a larger store and sell wholesale.  She is thankful to Edaprospo and Kiva because they provided her with the first loan for her business.  We know that Amelia will meet her goals with much work and effort, and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, milk, sugar, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jaime Adalberto

texts.es:
Jaime Adalberto, un hombre de 47 años que vive y trabaja junto a su familia en la ciudad de Ica, caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agro exportaciones, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a personas que quedaron sin ellos tras el sismo de 8.0 grados en el año 2007.  

Jaime se dedica a trabajar todo el tiempo para que junto a los ingresos que obtiene su esposa como empleada del hogar puedan ganar el dinero que se necesita para poder  cuidar y alimentar a sus 2 niños, uno de sus menores tiene 3 años y ya se encuentra cursando el nivel inicial, mientras que el mayor  de 8 años se encuentra en el nivel primario, ambos acuden diariamente a la escuela.	
					
El señor Jaime es maestro constructor, él se ha dedico a esta actividad desde muy joven, trabaja en promedio 8 horas diarias, gracias a su padre y la motivación que le brindo él puede dedicarse a este negocio ya que desde muy joven empezó a enseñarle todo lo necesario para que desenvolviera en este rubro. En un día Jaime puede atender sólo a un cliente, debido a la cantidad de trabajo que le demandan y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente S/.60 diarios y en algunas ocasiones cuando tiene mucha suerte y trabajo puede ganar hasta S/.100 lo que le permite pagar algunos gastos que tiene. Su pequeño negocio tiene éxito por la gran cantidad de gente que necesita algunas labores del sector construcción, ya sea porque estos son muy complicados de realizar. Por el momento desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarlo para poder realizarse un tratamiento médico en la rodilla debido a que sufrió un accidente en la rodilla y le es muy incomodo para trabajar, también desea poder comprar algunos muebles que son necesarios para sus hijos, él desea poder pagar el total de su crédito en 12 meses.

El piensa que este préstamo lo ayudará mucho a mejorar en la agilidad de su trabajo, debido a que por el momento tarda más de lo normal por el constante movimiento de la rodilla herida, y los muebles que podrá comprar le permitirá darle a sus pequeños una mayor comodidad y así espera que en algunos meses este totalmente recuperado y empiece a mejorar su vivienda lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su sueño de terminar de construir y que sus hijos sean unos grandes profesionales en futuro.
texts.en:
Jaime Alberto, 47, lives with his family in Ica.  Ica has had an increase in investments, not only in agricultural exports but also in the opening of new commercial centers that offer work to people who have been unemployed since the 2007 8.0 earthquake. 
Jaime works full time to put earnings together along with those of his wife, a domestic, so that they can have the money needed to care for and feed their two children.  One of the children is 3 and he is already in pre-school, while the older is 8 and in the first grade.  They both attend school every day.

Jaime has been a master construction worker for the past 8 years and works an average of 8 hours a day.  Thanks to his father and the motivation that he has, he can perform this work since his father started teaching him all he needed to know from the time he was very young.  Jaime can only take care of one customer a day because of the amount of work that he is asked to do, and this lets him earn about 60 sols per day.  Sometimes when he is very lucky and has many jobs, he can earn up to 100 sols.  This allows him to pay some of the expenses that he has.  

His small business is successful because of the great number of people who need construction jobs done, since these are very complicated to do.  Now he wants the loans from Kiva to help him have medical treatment on his knee because he had an accident and it’s hard for him to work.  He also wants to buy some furniture for his children and he would like to be able to pay off the financing in 12 months.
He thinks that this loan will help him improve his agility in his work, because now it takes him longer than normal since he is constantly moving his injured knee.  The furniture that he will buy will be more comfortable for his children and since he expects to be totally recuperated in a few months, he wants to begin improving his house.  The loan will help him fulfill his dream of finishing building and helping his children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to have medical treatment on his knee and to buy furniture for his children

loans.name: Abdulai's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are a group of teachers from the township of Magburaka, in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 6,100,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school's bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayment on their behalf. 

Abdulai (pictured in the left) is the leader of this group. Abdulai is forty years old. He was born in a village called Makam in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending primary schools. Abdulai has been a teacher for seventeen years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron and corrugated zinc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron and corrugated zinc

loans.name: Jose Delson

texts.en:
Jose is 28 years old and resides in Cofradía. He's been in a committed relationship for eight years and has a nine year old daughter. His wife Nelly works in a factory in the area.
